assessor: <entryFree id="n4042" type="main" key="assessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assessor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that sits by one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assessor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii regibus suis augurem adsessorem dederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 95</bibl></cit>.—In judic. lang., <hi rend="ital">the assistant of a judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assessor</hi> (cf. Zimm. Rechtsgesch. 3, p. 21 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">Hugo, Rechtsgesch. p. 685),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assessorius: <entryFree id="n4043" type="hapax" key="assesso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assessōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>assessor</etym>, <sense id="n4043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to an assessor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus in adsessorio (sc. libro de adsessoris officio) ait, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:5:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 5, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assessura: <entryFree id="n4044" type="main" key="assessu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assessūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of assessor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assessorship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:14:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assessus: <entryFree id="n4045" type="main" key="assessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assessus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of assideo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4046" type="hapax" key="assessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assessus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>assideo</etym>, <sense id="n4046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting by</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">Turpior adsessu non erit ulla meo,</quote> <trans><tr>for sitting by me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:11:49" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 11, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assestrix: <entryFree id="n4047" type="hapax" key="assestrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assestrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assessor</etym>, <sense id="n4047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that sits by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female assistant</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 73, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asseveranter: <entryFree id="n4048" type="main" key="asse^ve_ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕvēranter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕvē-rātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <sense id="n4048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. assevero <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
asseveratio: <entryFree id="n4049" type="main" key="asse^ve_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕvērātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assevero</etym>. <sense id="n4049.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An earnest pursuit</hi> of any thing; hence, </sense><sense id="n4049.1" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">a vehement assertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirmation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asseveration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni tibi adseveratione affirmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: confirmatio est nostrorum argumentorum expositio cum adseveratione, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:2" default="NO">11, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:67" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4049.2" n="B" level="2"> In Tac., of actions, <hi rend="ital">a persevering earnestness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur multā adseveratione ... coguntur patres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatio tamen apud patres adseveratione eādem peracta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n4049.3" n="II" level="1"> In the old gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">a strengthening part of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a word of emphasis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adiciebant et adseverationem, ut heu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: (adseverat heu, dum miserabili orationi ipsius, qui dicit dolorem, adjungit, Spald.).</sense></entryFree>
assevero: <entryFree id="n4050" type="main" key="asse^ve_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĕvēro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, B. and K., Halm), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>severus</etym>. <sense id="n4050.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">with earnestness</hi>, <pb n="179" /> <cb n="ASSI" /> <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue earnestly</hi> (opp. jocari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl>; rare in early Latin; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: affirmo, confirmo, assero, dico): quae est ista defensio? utrum adseveratur in hoc an tentatur?</quote> <trans><tr>is this matter conducted in earnest?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to assert strongly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare positively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affirm</hi> (in the class. per. only in prose; with this word in this sense, cf. the Engl. to assure; the Germ. versichern; the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)sxuri/zomai, bebaio/w</foreign>; and the Lat. confirmo, adfirmo): neminem eorum haec adseverare audias, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre adseverat sese ab Oppianico destitutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum illud firmissime adseverabat in exsilium se iturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periti rerum adseverant non ferre (Arabiam) tantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 83</bibl></cit> Jan (others <hi rend="ital">adstruxerunt</hi>, v. astruo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Halicarnasii mille et ducentos per annos nullo motu terrae nutavisse sedes suas adseveraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 42</bibl>; 14, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantissime adseveravit fore, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>.—Also, de aliquā re: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc meum, de quo tanto opere hoc libro adseveravi, umquam adfirmabo esse verius quam tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:237" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad modum adversarius de quāque re adseveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem ullā de re posse contendere neque adseverare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 35</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adseverant magni artus Germanicam originem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4050.1" n="B" level="2"> In Tac., of conduct (cf. asseveratio): <cit><quote lang="la">viri gravitatem adseverantes,</quote> <trans><tr>assuming an air of gravity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 18</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4050.2" n="II" level="1"> In App., <hi rend="ital">to make grave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 10</bibl></cit>, and 8, p. 203, 24.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adsĕvēranter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">adsĕ-vērātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with asseveration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emphatically.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4050.3" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">adsĕvēranter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui valde adseveranter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 19, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haec Antiochus fere multo etiam adseverantius (dixit),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4050.4" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">adsĕvērātē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoedias scite atque adseverate actitavit,</quote> <trans><tr>earnestly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assibilo: <entryFree id="n4051" type="main" key="assi_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sībĭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n4051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whisper at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a thing (only in the post-Aug. poets): alno adsibilat alnus, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 68; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Rapt. Pros. 2:225" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 225</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moto adsibilat aëre ventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 258</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">verb act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens animam adsibilat aris, i. e. sibilando amittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:578" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 578</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assiccesco: <entryFree id="n4052" type="hapax" key="assiccesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-siccesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n4052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assicco: <entryFree id="n4053" type="main" key="assicco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sicco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi> (only in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Col.): aliquid in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:18" default="NO">2, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:22" default="NO">1, 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulam et rorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:3" default="NO">12, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33:1 al" default="NO">12, 33, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 26</bibl></cit> (Haase, <hi rend="ital">siccare</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
assiculus: <entryFree id="n4054" type="main" key="assi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭcŭlus</orth>, v. axiculus.</entryFree>
assidelae: <entryFree id="n4055" type="gloss" key="assi^de^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdĕlae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assideo</etym>, <sense id="n4055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tables at which the priests sat and offered sacrifices</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 17</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
assideo: <entryFree id="n4056" type="main" key="assi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĭdĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Fleck., Kayser, Rib., Merk., Halm, Weissenb.; both, K. and H.), <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n4056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sit by</hi> or near a person or thing (syn. assido). </sense><sense id="n4056.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4056.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud carbones adsident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tiburti forte adsedimus ego et Marcus filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adsidens et attente audiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 55, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4056.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4056.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">be at</hi> one's side, as attendant, aid, protector; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacrimans in carcere mater noctes diesque adsideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes Macedoniae hujus (Plancii) periculo commoti huic adsident, pro hoc laborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pompeius P. Lentulo consuli frequens adsideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (nobilium adulescentes) ibi adsidebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut assidens inplumibus pullis avis Serpentium adlapsus timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidens foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Macc. 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 26, 30</bibl>.—Hence, in judic. lang., t. t., <hi rend="ital">to aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist one in the office of judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be an assessor</hi> (cf. assessor): <cit><quote lang="la">rarus in tribunali Caesaris Piso, et si quando adsideret, atrox ac dissentire manifestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:22:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:22:3" default="NO">1, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:22:6 al" default="NO">1, 22, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4056.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the sick, <hi rend="ital">to attend upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidet aegrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsidet una soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:3:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: si alius casus <cb n="ASSI" /> lecto te adflixit, habes qui Adsideat, fomenta paret, medicum roget, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidente amantissimā uxore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidere valetudini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n4056.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be busily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduously engaged about</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernaculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend to</tr>, <tr>to mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4056.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4056.8" n="A" level="2"> Of a place, <hi rend="ital">to station one's self before;</hi> and more freq. in a hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to be encamped before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sit down before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockade;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidere sepultae urbis ruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope moenia Romana adsidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus adsidet hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum muros adsidet hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidendo castellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:623" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidebat oppugnabatque oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: Amisumque adsideri audiebat, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 830</bibl> P. (IV. 8 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">adsessos Capuae muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 453</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n4056.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be near one in qualities</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resemble</hi> (in prose, instead of it, accedo; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. dissideo, q. v.): parcus Adsidet insano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit> (sedet stulto proximus eique simillimus est, Crucq.; cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)ggu\s ei)=nai/ tini</foreign>.—Acc. to Schmid the figure is drawn from the sitting together of similar classes in the theatre).</sense></entryFree>
assido: <entryFree id="n4057" type="main" key="assi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sīdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., B. and K., Dietsch; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Roth), sēdi, no <sense id="n4057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to sit down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seat one's self somewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sit</hi> (syn. assideo). </sense><sense id="n4057.1" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: Adsido; accurrunt servi; <cit><quote lang="la">soccos detrahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidamus, si videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Assidentem (Caesarem) conspirati specie officii circumsteterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4057.2" n="b" level="4"> With an <hi rend="ital">adjunct of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sellā apud magistrum adsideres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic in arā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo mulier adsidat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aves videre possint, ubi adsidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super aspidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila in culmine domūs assedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi assidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 53 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4057.3" n="c" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> (cf. assideo, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">Hiempsal dextrā Adherbalem adsedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se utrumque adsidere jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 10" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>.—Of an orator who sits down after he has finished his speech: Peroravit aliquando, adsedit; <cit><quote lang="la">surrexi ego,</quote> <trans><tr>he sat down</tr>, <tr>took his seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito adsedit, cum sibi venenis ereptam memoriam diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 37, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Set ubi adsedit, Catilina etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assidue: <entryFree id="n4058" type="main" key="assi^du^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. assiduus <sense id="n4058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
assiduitas: <entryFree id="n4059" type="main" key="assi^du^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. assiduus</etym>, <sense id="n4059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a constant presence with</hi> any one (<hi rend="ital">in order to serve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, etc.; cf. assideo, I. B. 1.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n4059.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">medici adsiduitas,</quote> <trans><tr>constant attendance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidiana amicorum adsiduitas et frequentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum, qui abs te defensi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:ib. 1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandemque adsiduitatem tibi se praebuisse postridie,</quote> <trans><tr>the same unceasing attendance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā adsiduitate cotidianā aliquem tractare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—So of the constant attendance, in the assemblies, of candidates for office (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare in oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">altera pars petitionis, quae in populari ratione versatur, desiderat nomenclationem, blanditiam, adsiduitatem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:section=43" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduitatis et operarum harum cotidianarum putat esse consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valuit adsiduitate, valuit observandis amicis, valuit liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo aut frugalitatis existimatione praeclara aut, id quod levissimum est, adsiduitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>. —First in Suet., without access. idea, for <hi rend="ital">constant presence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4059.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">gen. of thing</hi>, with the idea of continuance in time, <hi rend="ital">the continuance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy of any thing;</hi> sometimes <hi rend="ital">a frequent occurrence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repetition of it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduitate molestiarum sensum omnem humanitatis ex animis amittimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduitate cotidianā et consuetudine oculorum adsuescunt animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum,</quote> <trans><tr>unbroken correspondence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi adsiduitas aluit audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 41, 9</bibl></cit>: ejusdem litterae, Auct. <cb n="ASSI" /> ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl>.—Without <hi rend="ital">gen. of thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis in rem publicam nostram labor, adsiduitas, dimicatio,</quote> <trans><tr>assiduity</tr>, <tr>unremitting application</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduitas illius non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri mendacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 20, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">38, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assiduo: <entryFree id="n4060" type="main" key="assi^du^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. assiduus <sense id="n4060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4061" type="hapax" key="assi^du^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. assiduus</etym>, <sense id="n4061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to apply constantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio flagella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 30, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assiduus: <entryFree id="n4062" type="main" key="assi^du^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, perh. only by confusion of 1. assiduus with 2. assiduus), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>as-do; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 15</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n4062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributepayer;</hi> a name given by Servius Tullius to the citizens of the upper and more wealthy classes, in opp. to proletarii, citizens of the lowest classes, who benefit the state only by their progeny (proles). </sense><sense id="n4062.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum locupletes assiduos (Servius) appellāsset ab aere dando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl></cit>.—So in the Twelve Tables: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduo vindex adsiduus esto. Proletario jam civi, cui quis volet vindex esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dirks. Transl. 154 sq.: locuples enim est assiduus, ut ait L. Aelius, appellatus ab aere dando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 67, 25</bibl>: quibus erant pecuniae satis locupletes, assiduos; <cit><quote lang="la">contrarios proletarios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduum ab aere dando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduus in Duodecim Tabulis pro locuplete dictus, ab assibus, id est aere dando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: adsiduus dicitur, qui in eā re, quam frequenter agit, quasi consedisse videatur. Alii assiduum locupletem, quasi multorum assium dictum putārunt. Alii eum, qui sumptu proprio militabat, ab asse dando vocatum existimārunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 9</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ditiores qui asses dabant, assidui dicti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 58</bibl></cit> P.; cf. vindex ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Orth. p. 2318</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus dicebatur apud antiquos, qui assibus ad aerarii expensam conferendis erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 1, pp. 496-502.—</sense><sense id="n4062.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rich person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctīsque diesque adsiduo satis superque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4062.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, adject. of a <hi rend="ital">first-rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">classical</hi> writer: <cit><quote lang="la">classicus adsiduusque aliquis scriptor, non proletarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. on the other hand: <cit><quote lang="la">Proletario sermone nunc quidem utere,</quote> <trans><tr>common talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 157</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4063" type="main" key="assi^du^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Lachm., Fleck., B. and K., Rib., Weissenb., Jahn; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk., Halm, K. and H.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from assideo, as continuus from contineo, etc.</etym>: <sense id="n4063.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Itaque qui adest, adsiduus (est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=99" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 99</bibl></cit>; but more correctly: adsiduus dicitur, qui in eā re, quam frequenter agit, quasi consedisse videatur, <hi rend="ital">to have sat down to it</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 9</bibl> Müll.; hence, </sense><sense id="n4063.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Constantly present somewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attending to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupied with</hi> something (cf. deses, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, from desideo): <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic filius adsiduus in praediis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl>, b, § <cit><quote lang="la">3: fuit adsiduus mecum praetore me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper boni adsiduique domini (i. e. qui frequenter adest in praediis) referta cella vinariā, oleariā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos liberos agricolas adsiduos esse cupiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his potius tradam adsiduis uno opere eandem incudem diem noctemque tundentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elevat adsiduos copia longa viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:31:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 31, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus, Assiduis pulsatus equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduus in oculis hominum fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis, adsiduus magis quam gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes adsiduiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa scholas adsiduus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(patrimonia) majora fiunt Incude adsiduā semperque ardente camino,</quote> <trans><tr>by the busy anvil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Retibus adsiduis penitus scrutante macello Proxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quem cavat adsiduis sudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:248" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mandatis illius maxime adsiduus esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 6, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 3</bibl>.—So of the constant attendance of candidates for office, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9:37" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9, 37</bibl> (cf. these passages in their connection).—Hence sarcastically of parasites: <cit><quote lang="la">urbani adsidui cives, quos scurras vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4063.2" n="II" level="1"> With the prominent idea of continuance in time, <hi rend="ital">continual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unremitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi> (very freq. both in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">foro operam adsiduam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: ludis adsiduas operas dare, <pb n="180" /> <cb n="ASSI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 974</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars terraï perusta solibus adsiduis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:995" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 995</bibl></cit>, and 4, 392; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 97: repulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9:37" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9, 37</bibl>: febricula, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidua ac diligens scriptura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:33:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum adsidua insidens cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecatio justi adsidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(portae) adsiduus custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa temporum quies et continuum populi otium et assidua senatūs tranquillitas, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum (nominis) Octavius abstulit udo Caedibus adsiduis gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:243" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarorum incursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa aurea adsiduissimi usūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:68" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:31" default="NO">2, 19, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:56 al" default="NO">3, 11, 56 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hic ver adsiduum atque alienis mensibus aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 486</bibl></cit> et saep.: Non feret assiduas potiori te dare noctes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 13</bibl>.—Sometimes said with a degree of impatience, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everlasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus Tectorum adsiduos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvius adsiduo Syrophoenix udus amomo,</quote> <trans><tr>with his everlasting perfume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 159</bibl></cit> Jahn: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduo ruptae lectore columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">continually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without intermission.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4063.3" n="I" level="1"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĭdŭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">operam dare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpotare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n4063.4" n="II" level="1"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sum adsidue, scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore indisciplinatorum adsidue erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:20:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 20, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsidue veniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines nobiles adsidue unā scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidue cantare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia, quae suis locis dicentur adsidue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum assidue minores parentibus liberi essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut oculis adsidue videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 41, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: frequenter et adsidue consequi aliquid, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 56, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:51:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 51, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentare aedem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestare aliquem ornatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DEFLERE ALIQVEM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 950, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsidue recens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 277</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp</hi> not found.—* <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭdŭissimē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">Adsiduissime mecum fuit Dionysius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>: salientes (aquae) adsiduissime interdiu et noctu, Sen. Cons. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 2, p. 252" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 2, p. 252</bibl>; for the comparison of the <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> (as in arduus, exiguus, egregius, industrius, perpetuus, etc.), v. Rudd. I. p. 180, n. 58.</sense></entryFree>
assignatio: <entryFree id="n4064" type="main" key="assigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assignātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assigno</etym>, <sense id="n4064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assignment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allotment;</hi> most freq. of the allotment of land to colonists (cf. assigno, I. A.); <cit><quote lang="la">with and without agrorum: haec agrorum adsignatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae adsignationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis adsignationis modum non excessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of other things (cf. assigno, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assignator: <entryFree id="n4065" type="hapax" key="assigna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assignātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id. I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n4065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assigner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assignifico: <entryFree id="n4066" type="main" key="assigni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-signĭfĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n4066.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim tonsores non fuisse adsignificant antiquorum statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4066.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To denote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point out</hi>: locum, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assigno: <entryFree id="n4067" type="main" key="assigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assigno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, B. and K., Halm, Weissenb., Jahn, K. and H.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n4067.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4067.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mark out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appoint to</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to assign;</hi> hence also, <hi rend="ital">to distribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give by assigning</hi>, as t. t. of the division of public lands to the colonists (cf. assignatio; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: ascribo, attribuo): uti agrum eis militibus, legioni Martiae et legioni quartae ita darent, adsignarent, ut quibus militibus amplissime dati, adsignati essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (triumviri) ad agrum venerant adsignandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 21</bibl>; Sic. Fl. p. 18 Goes.—</sense><sense id="n4067.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> something <hi rend="ital">to some one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confer upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ex agro tuo tantum adsignes, quantum corpore meo occupari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: munus humanum adsignatum a deo, <cb n="ASSI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparitores a praetore adsignati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cuique ordinem adsignari e re publicā esset, eum adsignare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equiti certus numerus aeris est adsignatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: aspera bella componunt, agros adsignant, oppida condunt, <hi rend="ital">to assign dwellingplaces</hi> to those roaming about (with ref. to I. A.), * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura avibus caelum adsignavit,</quote> <trans><tr>appointed</tr>, <tr>allotted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 72, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de adsignandis libertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 4</bibl></cit>. 1 sq.: adsignavit eam vivam, <foreign lang="greek">pare/sthsen</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">he presented her</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 9, 41 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n4067.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impute to one as a crime</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to reckon as a service</hi> (in the last sense not before the Aug. period; in Cic. only in the first signification). </sense><sense id="n4067.4" n="a" level="4"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero id homini tum quisquam, sed tempori adsignandum putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec si minus apta videntur huic sermoni, Attico adsigna, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hoc improbitati et sceleri meo potius quam imprudentiae miseriaeque adsignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 4, 6</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit, ne unius amentiam civitati adsignarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>' permixtum vehiculis agmen ac pleraque fortuita fraudi suae adsignantes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl>; and without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: me culpam fortunae adsignare, calamitatem crimini dare; <cit><quote lang="la">me amissionem classis obicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit> Zumpt.—</sense><sense id="n4067.5" n="b" level="4"> In bon. part.: nos omnia, quae prospera tibi evenere, tuo consilio adsignare; <cit><quote lang="la">adversa casibus incertis belli et fortunae delegare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cypri devictae nulli adsignanda gloria est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:38" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua fortia facta gloriae principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sibi gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec infinitas naturae omnium artifici possit adsignari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventionem ejus (molyos) Mercurio adsignat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4, 8, § 26 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4067.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4067.7" n="A" level="2"> With the access. idea of object, design, <hi rend="ital">to commit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give over</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one to keep or take care of (rare, mostly post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus deportanda Romam Regina Juno adsignata erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>' Eumenem adsignari custodibus praecepit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:62" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1" default="NO">4, 9, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonos juvenes adsignare famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4067.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make a mark upon something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seal it</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">adsigna, Marce, tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:81" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscribente et adsignante domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:126" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:8:20" default="NO">26, 8, 20</bibl>: cum adsignavero iis fructum hunc, <hi rend="ital">shall have sealed</hi> and sent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 15, 28</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum in clausulā positum adsignatur auditori et infigitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is impressed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assilio: <entryFree id="n4068" type="main" key="assi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĭlĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Kayser; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">as-</orth>, Merk.), sĭlui (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 906</bibl> P., and Jahn ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 526</bibl>), <itype>sultum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. salio</etym>, <sense id="n4068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> something. </sense><sense id="n4068.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (most freq. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Cum saepe adsiluit defensae moenibus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiliens admissarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpedo adsultantes pisciculos attrahens, donec tam prope accedant, ut adsiliat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:257" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> freq. of water, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing (cf. 2. salio): <cit><quote lang="la">tactumque vereri Assilientis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 107</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:612" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 612</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsiliunt fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:591" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(insulae) quas spumifer adsilit Aegon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:56 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 56 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4068.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: nam neque adsiliendum statim est ad genus illud orationis, <hi rend="ital">to jump to</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
assimilanter: <entryFree id="n4069" type="main" key="assi^mi^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmĭlanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. assimulo <sense id="n4069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
assimilatio: <entryFree id="n4070" type="main" key="assi^mi^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmĭlātio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), v. assimulatio.</entryFree>
assimilis: <entryFree id="n4071" type="main" key="assi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĭmĭlis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl, Baiter</itype>, Rib.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk.), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi> (cf. ad, D. 4.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case> with <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose; once in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n4071.1" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam adsimile hujus Quasi tu numquam facti feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latuscula adsimili lateris flexurā praedita nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 336</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">assimilis sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4071.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex cadenti imminet adsimilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: raritas adsimilis spongiis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeri-adsimilis capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4071.3" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: Nam hoc adsimile<cb n="ASSI" />  est quasi de fluvio qui aquam derivat sibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4071.4" n="d" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inde sequetur, Adsimili ratione alias ut postulet ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 493</bibl></cit>, and 4, 425.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭ-mĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsimiliter mi hodie optigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assimiliter: <entryFree id="n4072" type="main" key="assi^mi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. assimilis <sense id="n4072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
assimulanter: <entryFree id="n4073" type="main" key="assi^mu^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmŭlanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. assimulo, <sense id="n4073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
assimulaticius: <entryFree id="n4074" type="main" key="assi^mu^la_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmŭlātĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>assimulo</etym>, <sense id="n4074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not real;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">nominal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">titular</hi>: insignia, Cod. Th. 6, 22, § 8.</sense></entryFree>
assimulatio: <entryFree id="n4075" type="main" key="assi^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmŭlātĭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, not <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭ-mĭlātĭo</orth>; v. assimulo <sense id="n4075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an assimilating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4075.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A being similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiosa adsimulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4075.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a feigned adoption of the opinion of one's hearers</hi>: est (adsimulatio) cum id, quod scimus facile omnes audituros, dicimus nos timere, quomodo accipiant; sed tamen veritate commoveri, ut nihilo setius dicamus, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 37, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4075.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A comparison</hi> of one thing with others: <cit><quote lang="la">dolosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:18:19:section=24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 18, 19, § 24</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 16, 2, § 18.</sense></entryFree>
assimulo:
<entryFree id="n4076" type="main" key="assi^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĭmŭlo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>Ritschl, Lachmann</itype>, Fleck., B. and K., Rib., Halm in Tac.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmŭlo</orth>, Merk.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">adsĭmĭlo</orth>, Halm in Quint., Tisch.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n4076.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> one thing <hi rend="ital">like</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to consider as similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compare</hi> (in the class. period rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Linquitur, ut totis animalibus adsimulentur,</quote> <trans><tr>that they are like complete animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 914</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite ergo adsimulari iis,</quote> <trans><tr>be like them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simile ex specie comparabili aut ex conferundā atque adsimulandā naturā judicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor, perceptā semel imitandi ratione, adsimulabit quidquid acceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cohibere parietibus deos neque in ullam humani oris speciem adsimulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia assimulare freto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam totius Britanniae bipenni adsimulavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os longius illi adsimulat porcum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eid. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui adsimilāstis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 46, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (naturam) Gadareus primus adsimulāsse aptissime visus est,</quote> <trans><tr>to have designated by very suitable comparisons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4076.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To represent something that is not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as real</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pretend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulate;</hi> constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> ante - class. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">quasi;</hi> v. assimilis (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post - Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n4076.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has bene ut adsimules nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeumque jubasque Divini adsimulat capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Assimulavit anum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium cum conjuge falsum Phasias assimulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictos timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:136" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem humanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me sic adsimulabam, quasi stolidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se laetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4076.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: furere adsimulavit, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4076.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me adsimulem insanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsimulet se Tuam esse uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nempe ut adsimulem me amore istius differri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire me adsimulabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 53 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4076.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsimulato quasi hominem quaesiveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> Ita nos adsimulabimus. <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Sed ita adsimulatote, quasi ego sim peregrinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsimulabo quasi nunc exeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—And <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Obsecro, Quid si adsimulo, satin
