est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—!*? The much-discussed question, whether adsimilo or adsimulo is the best orthog. (cf. Gron. Diatr. Stat. c. 6, p. 72 sq., and Hand ad h. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 11</bibl> Frotscher; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57</bibl> Bremi; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl> Passow; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 10</bibl> Walch; Bessel, Misc. Phil. Crit. 1, 5 al.), is perh. solved in the foll. remarks: Such is the affinity of the sound of <hi rend="ital">ŭ</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ĭ</hi> in Lat., that when they stand in two successive syllables, separated by the semivowel <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">u</hi> is accommodated to the <hi rend="ital">i.</hi> Thus, from consŭl arises consĭlĭum; from exsŭl, exsĭlĭum; from famŭl, famĭlĭa; so the terminations ĭlis and ŭlus, not ŭlis and ĭlus (these few, mutĭlus, nubĭlus, pumĭlus,<pb n="181" /> <cb n="ASSI" />  rutĭlus, appear to be founded in the <hi rend="ital">u</hi> of the first syllable; but for the heteroclites gracila, sterila, etc., a <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> gracilus, sterilus, etc., is no more needed than for Bacchanal orum, a <case>nom.</case> Bacchanalium, and for carioras, Manil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> MSS., a form cariorus, a, um); and so it is also explained, that from the orig. facul and difficul arose faculter, facultas; difficulter, difficultas; not facŭlis, facŭliter, facŭlītas; difficŭlis, difficŭlĭter, difficŭlĭtas; but facilis, faciliter, facilitas; difficilis, difficiliter, difficilitas. This principle, applied to the derivatives of simul, shows the correctness of the orthography simulo, simulatio, simulator, with similis, similitudo, similitas; adsimulo, adsimulatio, adsimulator, with adsimilis; dissimulo, dissimulatio, dissimulator, with dissimilis and dissimilitudo, etc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 362</bibl> P.: <hi rend="ital">Similo</hi> non dicimus, sed <hi rend="ital">similis est.</hi> Sane dixerunt auctores <hi rend="ital">simulat</hi> per <hi rend="ital">u</hi>, hoc est <foreign lang="greek">o(moia/zei</foreign>. But since the copyists knew that the more rare signif. of <hi rend="ital">making like</hi> was not generically connected in the words simulare and adsimulare with the more usual one of <hi rend="ital">imitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissembling</hi>, they wrote, where the former was required, sim<hi rend="ital">i</hi>lo, adsim<hi rend="ital">i</hi>lo, and gave occasion thereby to the entirely unfounded supposition that the ancients wrote, for the signif. <hi rend="ital">making like</hi>, similo, adsimilo; for that of <hi rend="ital">imitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feigning</hi>, simulo, adsimulo Fr.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmŭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4076.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Made similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis mortalibus adsimulata Ipsa quoque ex aliis debent constare elementis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:980" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 980</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montibus adsimulata Nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae lituraeque omnes adsimulatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia folio querno adsimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phloginos ochrae Atticae adsimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favillae adsimilatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsimilatus Filio Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4076.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Imitated</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissembled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritas adsimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsimulatā castrorum consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia vera, alia adsimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus sanguinis ac virium declamationes habent quam orationes, quod in illis vera, in his adsimilata materia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:31 al" default="NO">9, 2, 31 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.—* <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭmŭlanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> (qs. from the <pos>P. a.</pos> assimulans, which is not found), <hi rend="ital">in a similar manner</hi>: dicta haec, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 40, 25</bibl>.</sense>
‡* <orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭpondĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>as-pondus</etym>, <sense id="n4076.8" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the weight of one as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pound weight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=169" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 169</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
assiratum: <entryFree id="n4077" type="gloss" key="assira_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assirātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink composed of wine and blood;</hi> as, acc. to Festus, the ancient Latins called blood <hi rend="ital">assir</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
assis: <entryFree id="n4078" type="main" key="assis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = as, v. as <sense id="n4078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n4079" type="main" key="assis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = axis, v. 1. axis.</entryFree>
assisto: <entryFree id="n4080" type="main" key="assisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sisto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Fleck., Lachm., B. and K., Rib., Halm; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk.), astĭti, no <sense id="n4080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (cf. absisto), <hi rend="ital">to place one's self somewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post one's self.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4080.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mane tu atque adsiste ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsistite omnes contra me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adsisterent coram Domino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiste altrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic propter hunc adsiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui nunc hic adsistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Accede, nate, adsiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsi ad fores adsisterent, imperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut contra omnes hostium copias in ponte unus (Cocles) adsisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quem Turnus super adsistens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Donec Laërtius heros Astitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 125</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4080.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4080.3" n="A" level="2"> As indicating a completed action, <hi rend="ital">to stand somewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita jacere talum, ut rectus adsistat,</quote> <trans><tr>may stand erect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec refert quibus adsistas regionibus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 964</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto assistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:457" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:631" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 631</bibl></cit>: adsisto divinis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim scribenti, ediscenti et cogitanti praeceptor adsistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:299" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 299</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulum tribunalibus Italia et publicae provinciae adsisterent, i. e. comparerent jura accepturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4080.4" n="B" level="2"> Alicui. </sense><sense id="n4080.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand by one</hi> (as counsel) before a tribunal, <hi rend="ital">to defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi> (post-Aug. for the class. adesse, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">adsistebam Vareno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 10, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1</bibl>, <cb n="ASSU" /> 54; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4080.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand before one</hi> on trial, in judgment (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesari oportet te adsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assistrix: <entryFree id="n4081" type="main" key="assistrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assistrix</orth>, v. assestrix.</entryFree>
assitus: <entryFree id="n4082" type="main" key="assi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. 1. assero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4083" type="main" key="assi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sino</etym>, <sense id="n4083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated near</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">atria viridantibus adsita pratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque longule dissita neque proxime adsita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assius: <entryFree id="n4084" type="main" key="Assi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Assĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the city Assus</hi> (in Troas): lapis, <hi rend="ital">a kind of limestone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was used for coffins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and in which the body was soon consumed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">In Asso Troadis sarcophagus lapis fissili venā scinditur. Corpora defunctorum condita in eo absumi constat intra XL. dies exceptis dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 17, 27, § 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asso: <entryFree id="n4085" type="main" key="asso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asso</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>assus</etym>, <sense id="n4085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broil</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">assari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assaverunt Phase super ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 35, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assavit carnes ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Tob. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
associo: <entryFree id="n4086" type="main" key="asso^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŏcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unite with</hi> a person or thing (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cornua summis Adsociant malis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsociati principali curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, tit. 11.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente virens Phoeboque Melampus Associat passus,</quote> <trans><tr>goes with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:454" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 454</bibl></cit> Queck.</sense></entryFree>
associus: <entryFree id="n4087" type="hapax" key="asso^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŏcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">associating with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assoleo: <entryFree id="n4088" type="main" key="asso^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŏlĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., B. and K., Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Roth), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be accustomed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wont</hi> (to do, to happen, etc.; only in the 3d person <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> and <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ponite hic quae adsolent (sc. poni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 5</bibl>: quae adsolent, quaeque oportet Signa esse ad salutem, omnia huic esse video, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 1</bibl> (adsolent ergo consuetudinis est; <cit><quote lang="la">oportet rationis, Don.): cum multa adsoleat veritas praebere vestigia sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44</bibl>.—Hence the expression: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adsolet,</quote> <trans><tr>as is wont to happen</tr>, <tr>as is customary</tr>, <tr>as usual</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: prima classis vocatur, renuntiatur; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde, ita ut adsolet, suffragia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio, ut adsolet, rite facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob quem imbrem novemdiale, ut adsolet, sacrum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenas coronasque, ut illic assolet, obtulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in hortis D. Bruti auguris commentandi causā, ut adsolet, venissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones, non laetae, ut adsolet, neque insignibus fulgentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assolo: <entryFree id="n4089" type="main" key="asso^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŏlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ad-solum</etym>, <sense id="n4089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to level to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
assono: <entryFree id="n4090" type="main" key="asso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŏno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Jahn; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk.), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sound to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respond to</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">plangentibus assonat Echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reparabilis adsonat Echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:102" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 102</bibl></cit>.— With <case>acc.</case> of similar signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut canorae aviculae concentus suaves adsonarent,</quote> <trans><tr>struck up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assuctus: <entryFree id="n4091" type="main" key="assuctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assuctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. assugo.</entryFree>
assudasso: <entryFree id="n4092" type="hapax" key="assu_dasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sūdasso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n4092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. n.</hi> [from sudo, as capesso from capio, lacesso from lacio], <hi rend="ital">to fall into a violent sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat profusely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corculum adsudassit jam ex metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit> dub. (perh. <hi rend="ital">assudescit</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
assudesco: <entryFree id="n4093" type="hapax" key="assu_desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sūdesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n4093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sudo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to sweat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=109" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 109</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
assuefacio: <entryFree id="n4094" type="main" key="assu^e_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭē-făcĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, B. and K., Halm., Weissenb., Dinter), <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>assuetus</etym>, <sense id="n4094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accustom to</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to habituate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inure;</hi> constr., in Cicero's time, with <case>abl.</case>; later, with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. assuesco). </sense><sense id="n4094.1" n="a" level="4"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem puro sermone adsuefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 59, 213</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 10, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus rei exercitatione adsuefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo officio aut disciplinā adsuefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodam genere pugnae adsuefacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditus et adsuefactus alienis experimentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4094.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus adsuefactus sermoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 121</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl>, ext. 15: <cit><quote lang="la">parvulos probitati, modestiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non luxui aut voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: aliquem lanificio, Suet. <cb n="ASSU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:64" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4094.3" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad supplicia patrum plebem adsuefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4094.4" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo adsuetus in verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 23, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 2, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4094.5" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar (ceteras nationes) domuit, imperio populi Romani parere adsuefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos eodem remanere vestigio adsuefaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva momenta levium certaminum adsuefaciebant militem paenitere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assuesco: <entryFree id="n4095" type="main" key="assu^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŭesco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, B. and K., Rib., Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk.), ēvi, ētum, 3 (adsuëtus, four syll., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 14</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accustom one to</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to habituate;</hi> or, more freq., <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to accustom one's self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be accustomed to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4095.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.; constr. usu. with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> after the Aug. per. also with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>, or <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n4095.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (a constr. unjustly censured by Wunder, Rhein. Mus. 1829, II. p. 288 sq. The idea of the <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, which would require the <case>acc.</case> or <case>dat.</case> case, is not, as at a later period, prominent in the word, but that of suesco; accordingly, pr., to adopt some custom, to addict or apply one's self to a custom or habit, to become accustomed to something; so that the <hi rend="ital">abl. of specification</hi>, as in amore affici, pedibus laborare, etc., only designates more specifically the object which is the subject of that custom; cf. Gron. and Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35, 3</bibl>; Kritz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 9</bibl>; Rudd. II. p. 137 sq.; Ramsh. p. 427; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also assuefacio): homines labore adsiduo et cotidiano adsueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 58</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas non infuscata malevolentiā, non adsueta mendaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens adsueta multo Venatu nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Odrysius praedae assuetus amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus pugnae, quo adsuērant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35</bibl></cit> Gron.: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetae sanguine et praedā aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:17" default="NO">4, 12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetus imperio et inmoderatā licentiā militari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes alterius imperio ac nomine adsuetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princ. Hist. Fragm. 2, p. 341" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princ. Hist. Fragm. 2, p. 341</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4095.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitum voce vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votis jam nunc adsuesce vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsueti muros defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Candida de nigris et de candentibus atra Qui facere adsuērat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 533</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 504</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetus graecari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor adsuevit jam exigere laetitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(polypus) adsuetus exire e mari in lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas (legiones) in hiberna dimittere assuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4095.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uri adsuescere ad homines ne parvuli quidem possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>; Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 707</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">manus adsuetae ad sceptra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 152" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam inde a puero in omnia familiaria jura adsuetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:43" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4095.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae adsuetus erili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsuescent Latio Partha tropaea Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas ipsius soli, cui longo tempore adsuescitur,</quote> <trans><tr>to which one is accustomed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex more, cui adsuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quieti et otio per voluptates adsuescerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetus expeditionibus miles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsueti juventae Neronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo celerius (libri senatorum) rei publicae assuescerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jurationi non adsuescat os tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 23, 9</bibl></cit>.—Acc. to a rare constr., (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi> in the Gr. manner, <foreign lang="greek">ei)/qismai/ ti</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pueri, ne tanta animis adsuescite bella (for bellis),</quote> <trans><tr>accustom not your minds to such great wars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli juxta invia ac devia adsueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora atque inediam caelo solove adsuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit> Baumst.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis Gallici tumultūs adsuetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4095.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui, in mal. part.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempus et adsuetā ponere in arte juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium des corpori, adsueta vicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetos potare fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetam sibi causam suscipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—Hence with a <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius adsueto lumina nostra vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsueto propior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:306" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 306</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assuetudo: <entryFree id="n4096" type="main" key="assu^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭētūdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>; v. assuesco <sense id="n4096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assuetus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a being accustomed to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4096.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): amor adsuetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9</bibl></cit>, <pb n="182" /> <cb n="ASSU" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">20 Müll.: longāque alit assuetudine flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nil adsuetudine majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetudo mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 26, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu naturā sive adsuetudine suspensa et obscura verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confarreandi adsuetudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuetudo voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4096.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in mal. part. (v. assuesco, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assuetus: <entryFree id="n4097" type="main" key="assu^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>P. a.</pos>, from assuesco.</entryFree>
assugo: <entryFree id="n4098" type="hapax" key="assu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sūgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), no <sense id="n4098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ctum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to suck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsuctis labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1194</bibl></cit> Lachm.</sense></entryFree>
assula: <entryFree id="n4099" type="main" key="assu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭla</orth> (in many MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">astŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>axis</etym>. <sense id="n4099.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A splinter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at etiam cesso foribus facere hisce assulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melandrya vocantur quercūs assulis similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assula tenuis brevisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>. —Of marble, <hi rend="ital">a chip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n4099.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shingle</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sxi/dh</foreign>: Bibacul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assulatim: <entryFree id="n4100" type="main" key="assu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>assula</etym>, <sense id="n4100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in shivers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">splinters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aperite hasce ambas forīs Prius quam pultando assulatim foribus exitium dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc senem Osse tenus dolabo et concidam assulatim viscera,</quote> <trans><tr>will cut to bits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 105</bibl></cit> Brix: sumere cibum, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 72, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assulose: <entryFree id="n4101" type="hapax" key="assu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>qs. from an <pos>adj.</pos> assulosus, a, um; assula</etym>, <sense id="n4101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in shivers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">splinters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus, qui assulose frangitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 48, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assultim: <entryFree id="n4102" type="hapax" key="assultim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assultim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>assilio</etym>, <sense id="n4102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assultim ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 79</bibl></cit> Sillig.</sense></entryFree>
assulto: <entryFree id="n4103" type="main" key="assulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assulto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Halm</itype>, Jan), āvi, ātum, 1, <sense id="n4103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to jump</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leap to</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to jump</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leap;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> (only post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n4103.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(canis elephanto) adsultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae pellibus accinctae adsultabant, ut sacrificantes Bacchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4103.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of warlike operations, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiā vigiliā adsultatum est castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis adsultantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsultare ex diverso Tiridates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsultante per campos equite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera adsultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portarum moras frenis et hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:243" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:401" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 401</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4103.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">duo montes crepitu maximo adsultantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 83, 85, § 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assultus: <entryFree id="n4104" type="main" key="assultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assultus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaping to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum variis adsultibus urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsultibus et velocitate corporum uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assum: <entryFree id="n4105" type="main" key="assum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assum</orth>, v. adsum.</entryFree>
assumentum: <entryFree id="n4106" type="hapax" key="assu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assūmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>assuo</etym>, <sense id="n4106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is to be sewed upon</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">a patch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemo adsumentum panni rudis adsuit vestimento veteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assumo: <entryFree id="n4107" type="main" key="assu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sūmo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Lachm., Halm, B. and K., Weissenb., K. and H.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk.), <itype>mpsi, mptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> one's self, <hi rend="ital">to take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4107.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4107.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plura sibi adsumunt quam de se corpora mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus atque umor membris adsumitur intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1091</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of nourishment,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 27</bibl>, n. 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 200" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam committet, ut id, quod alteri detraxerit, sibi adsumat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Cereris adsumpta de Graeciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socius et administer omnium consiliorum adsumitur Scaurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos in societatem consilii avunculi adsumunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes conscii adsumpti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in societatem armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec decet aliter filium adsumi, si adsumatur a principe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 3: uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 83:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 83, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rursum (uxor) adsumeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsumptis duobus filiis ire perrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 48, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 23, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tunc adsumpsit eum Diabolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsumit Jesus Petrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (arietem) adsumens obtulit holocaustum pro filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 22, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 14, 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in familiam nomenque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit> et saepe: cautum dignos adsumere, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">choose as friends only those worthy</hi> of you, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsumpsit Jesus duodecim, i. e. as his disciples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 18, 31</bibl></cit>. —So of the assumption of our Lord to heaven: Dominus Jesus adsumptus est in <cb n="ASSU" /> caelum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4107.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libero tempore, omnis voluptas adsumenda est, omnis dolor repellendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem sibi ex aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut acer equus pugnae adsumit amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne quod sumatur in oratione, aut ex suā sumi vi atque naturā aut adsumi foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii (loci) adsumuntur extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 56</bibl> Wund.: <cit><quote lang="la">orator tractationem orationis sibi adsumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 54</bibl></cit>.—Also, like arrogare, <hi rend="ital">to usurp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mihi quicquam assumpsi neque hodie adsumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogam Assumptumque patrem commentaque sacra fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 558</bibl></cit>.—Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi> (eccl. Lat., after the Hebrew): <cit><quote lang="la">At ille adsumptā parabolā suā ait,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 23, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 7</bibl>; ib. Job, 27, 1; 29, 1.—</sense><sense id="n4107.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n4107.5" n="A" level="2"> Sometimes, like accipio, without the idea of action, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus Melliferarum apium sine membris corpora nasci, Et serosque pedes serasque assumere pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui sperant in Domino, adsument pennas sicut aquilae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a ventis alimenta adsumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illas assumere robora gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:421" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 421</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4107.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take in addition to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aliam quoque artem sibi adsumpserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum jam etiam noctis adsumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qui postea adsumerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Butram tibi Septiciumque et Sabinum adsumam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4107.7" n="C" level="2"> In logic, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join to a syllogism the minor proposition</hi>: Ea (propositio vera ac perspicua) est hujus modi: <hi rend="ital">Si quo die Romae ista caedes facta est</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ego Athenis eo die fui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in caede interesse non potui.</hi> Hoc quia perspicue verum est, nihil attinet approbari; quā re adsumi statim oportet hoc modo: <hi rend="ital">fui autem Athenis eo die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 36, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 51, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53, 108</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4107.8" n="D" level="2"> In gram.: adsumpta verba. </sense><sense id="n4107.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Epithets</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/qeta</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n4107.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Figurative expressions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tropes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assumptio: <entryFree id="n4108" type="main" key="assumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assumptĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>; v. adsumo <sense id="n4108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assumo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n4108.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a taking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumption</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">adsumptio culturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae adsumptio (eorum erit), nisi vita ex mortuis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies adsumptionis ejus (of the assumption of our Lord),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 9, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4108.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n4108.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An eager reception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adoption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes propter se adsumendas putamus, quia sit in his aliquid dignum adsumptione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4108.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. for concr.), <hi rend="ital">one that takes up</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus est adsumptio nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:88:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 88, 19</bibl></cit>.—Also (after the Hebrew), <hi rend="ital">that which is taken up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lifted up</hi> (with the voice), <hi rend="ital">a prophecy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(prophetae) viderunt tibi adsumptiones falsas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4108.5" n="C" level="2"> In logic, t. t., <hi rend="ital">the minor proposition of a syllogism</hi> (v. assumo, II. C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:37:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 37, 64</bibl>: adsumptio, quam <foreign lang="greek">pro/slhyin</foreign> īdem (dialectici) vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:53:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 53, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 9, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4108.6" n="D" level="2"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstance</hi>, = circumstantia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
assumptivus: <entryFree id="n4109" type="main" key="assumpti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assumptīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taken in addition</hi>: causa, t. t. of law, <hi rend="ital">which takes the defence of an action from an extraneous cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extrinsic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juridicalis (causa) in duas tribuitur partes, absolutam et adsumptivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24</bibl>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, p. 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 5, 5</bibl>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">assumptīvē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, p. 147</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
assumptus: <entryFree id="n4110" type="main" key="assumptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assumptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of assumo.</entryFree>
assuo: <entryFree id="n4111" type="main" key="assu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sew on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patch on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptis gravibus plerumque purpureus adsuitur pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 16</bibl></cit> K. and H.: <cit><quote lang="la">adsumentum vestimento veteri adsuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assurgo: <entryFree id="n4112" type="main" key="assurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-surgo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, B. and K., Rib., Merk., Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Roth), <itype>surrexi, surrectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand up</hi> (cf. ad, II. B.; class.; freq. in Verg., once in Ov., never in Hor.; syn.: surgo, consurgo, insurgo, orior). </sense><sense id="n4112.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4112.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dum laudatio recitatur, vos quaeso, qui eam detulistis, adsurgite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem adsurrexisse ex morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: Valentem e gravi corporis morbo adsurgentem,<cb n="ASSU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intortis adsurgens arduus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:476" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desine viso adsurgere pulvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Stil. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise up to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi>, out of respect. </sense><sense id="n4112.3" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quisquam in curiam venienti adsurrexit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Utque viro Phoebi chorus adsurrexerit omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 66</bibl></cit>: Ruricolae Cereri teneroque adsurgite Baccho, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honori numinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum palam esset ipsum quoque iisdem et assurgere et decedere viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum conaretur assurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 78 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adsurrexisse sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">coram</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">coram te adsurgere nequeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 31, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4112.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque assurgere neque salutare se dignantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et senes adsurgentes stabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 29, 8</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut majoribus natu adsurgatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adsurrectum ei non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos ineunti semper adsurgi etiam ab senatu in more est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>: so in a zeugma: haec enim ipsa sunt honorabilia ... salutari, appeti, decedi, adsurgi, deduci, etc. (decedi and adsurgi being <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> here, the other verbs <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl>.—Hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to give the preference to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to yield to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et Aminaeae vites ... Tmolius adsurgit quibus,</quote> <trans><tr>yields the palm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 98</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque adsurgentis dextrā plagamque ferentis Aeneae subiit mucronem, i.e. dextram attollentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 797</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4112.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">colles adsurgunt,</quote> <trans><tr>rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyramis adsurgit trecentis sexaginta tribus pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delos adsurgit Cynthio monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4112.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4112.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mount up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase in size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tower up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito adsurgens fluctu nimbosus Orion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1</bibl></cit>. 535: <cit><quote lang="la">adsurgens nox aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:566" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumores oriuntur, deinde desinunt, deinde rursus adsurgunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non coeptae adsurgunt turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra jacet aggeribus niveis informis septemque adsurgit in ulnas,</quote> <trans><tr>rises seven ells high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 355</bibl></cit>: Adsurgit ceu forte minor sub matre virente Laurus, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 244.—</sense><sense id="n4112.8" n="B" level="2"> Of mental objects. </sense><sense id="n4112.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sera querellis Haud justis adsurgis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>break out in complaints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsurgunt irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultionem adsurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4112.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rise in courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> (cf. the opp. affligi): <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet in adversis animoque adsurgit Adrastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:227" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 227</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4112.11" n="3" level="3"> Of style, etc., <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raro adsurgit Hesiodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque comoedia cothurnis adsurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitate heroici carminis animus adsurgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assus: <entryFree id="n4113" type="main" key="assus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qs. artus, then arsus, then assus; cf.: areo, ardeo, Van.</etym>, <sense id="n4113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roasted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4113.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elixus esse quam assus soleo suavior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passeris assi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit> Bentl. (K. and H., <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (piscibus) assis Languidus in cubitum jam se conviva reponet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 42</bibl>: res eadem magis alit jurulenta quam assa; <cit><quote lang="la">magis assa quam elixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 51, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes assae igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assa caro bubula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Par. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assum (quid) igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 221" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 221</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">assum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a roast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roasted</hi> meat: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulinum,</quote> <trans><tr>roast veal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—On the pun with assum = adsum, v. adsum <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n4113.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (prop. dried with heat, hence), <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mere</hi>: sudatio, <hi rend="ital">a steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sweating-bath</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">chroi\ i(drw=tes</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 27</bibl>; also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">assa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = sudatorium, <hi rend="ital">a sweating - bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudatory</hi> (without bathing), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: assa cella: <foreign lang="greek">a)fidrwth/rion</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.: sol, <hi rend="ital">a simple basking in the sun</hi> without a previous anointing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> or with nutrix, <hi rend="ital">a dry-nurse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc monstrant vetulae pueris repentibus assae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assae nutricis est infantem magis diligere quam adultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Ant. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Ant. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VOLVMNIAE DYNAMIDI NVTRICI ASSAE ET LIB. ...,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1512, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <trans><tr>rough</tr>, <tr>unhewn stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 417</bibl></cit>: vox, <hi rend="ital">the simple voice</hi>, unaccompanied by any instrument, Non. pp. 76 and 77; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 17" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 17</bibl>; inversely, assae tibiae, <pb n="183" /> <cb n="ASTE" /> <hi rend="ital">pipes not accompanied by the voice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 417</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assuspiro: <entryFree id="n4114" type="main" key="assuspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-suspīro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sigh at</hi> something; only twice in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assyria: <entryFree id="n4115" type="main" key="Assy^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Assyrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)assuri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Media</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Mesopotamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Babylonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kurdistan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Assyrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)assu/rios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Assyrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 429</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:212 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 212 al.</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Assyrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Assyrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:7:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 7, 17 al.</bibl>—Sometimes poetic for <hi rend="ital">Median</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phrygian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Indian</hi>, etc.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Phœnician Europa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 554" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum, i.e.,</quote> <trans><tr>Tyrian purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:41" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lake Gennesareth</tr>, <tr>in Palestine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Indian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus, i. e. Medica,</quote> <trans><tr>the citrontree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 14, § 48</bibl></cit>; cf. Voss ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
