ast: <entryFree id="n4116" type="main" key="ast"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ast</orth>, <sense id="n4116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, v. at <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
asta: <entryFree id="n4117" type="main" key="asta1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. hasta.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4118" type="main" key="Asta2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*asta</foreign>, <sense id="n4118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4118.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Asti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4118.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Hispania Bœtica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>; cf. Mann. Hisp. p. 286. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Asta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 21</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Astensians</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 26.</sense></entryFree>
astabores: <entryFree id="n4119" type="main" key="Asta^bo^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăbŏres</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-as</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)astabo/ras</foreign>, <sense id="n4119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a branch of the Nile in Ethiopia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tacazze</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Atbara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 53</bibl> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">Astobores</hi>).—In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăbŏras</orth>; cf. Mann. Afr. I. pp. 170 and 177.</sense></entryFree>
astacus: <entryFree id="n4120" type="greek" key="asta^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/stakos</foreign>, <sense id="n4120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of crab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4121" type="main" key="Asta^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/astakos</foreign>, <sense id="n4121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Menalippus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who is hence called</hi> Astacides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:513" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:725" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 725</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4122" type="main" key="Asta^cus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/astakos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)astako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Astacum, unde et ex eo Astacenus sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astapa: <entryFree id="n4123" type="main" key="Asta^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Estepa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22</bibl> and 23; cf. Mann. Hisp. 309.</sense></entryFree>
astape: <entryFree id="n4124" type="main" key="Asta^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăpē</orth>, v. Astapus.</entryFree>
astaphis: <entryFree id="n4125" type="greek" key="asta^phis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astăphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stafi/s</foreign>. <sense id="n4125.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A raisin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Uva passa, quam astaphida vocant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 12, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4125.1" n="II" level="1"> Astaphis agria. v. staphis.</sense></entryFree>
astapus: <entryFree id="n4126" type="main" key="Asta^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asta/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n4126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the Nile as it flows through Ethiopia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nilus) medios Aethiopas secat cognominatus Astapus, quod illarum gentium linguā significat aquam e tenebris profluentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 53</bibl></cit>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astusă-pes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astăpē</orth>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astŏsabas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)astosa/bas</foreign>, Strab.; cf. Mann. Afr. I. 170; acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a river of Ethiopia falling into the Nile</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">Abai</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
astarte: <entryFree id="n4127" type="main" key="Astarte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astartē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asta/rth</foreign> (Phoen. <foreign />, Gesen. Gesch. d. Hebr. Spr. 229; Heb. <foreign />), <sense id="n4127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Syro-Phœnician goddess;</hi> acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">the fourth Venus;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 5</bibl>; 11, 33.</sense></entryFree>
asteismos: <entryFree id="n4128" type="greek" key="aste^ismo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕïsmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stei/smo/s</foreign>; in rhet., <sense id="n4128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the more refined style of speaking</hi>, = urbanitas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 547</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 247</bibl> P., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 458</bibl> P., written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
astensis: <entryFree id="n4129" type="main" key="Astensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Asta.</entryFree>
aster: <entryFree id="n4130" type="greek" key="aster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aster</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sth/r</foreign>. <sense id="n4130.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A star</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4130.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4130.2" n="A" level="2"> Aster Atticus, <hi rend="ital">the Italian starwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aster amellus, Linn.: aster ab aliquis bubonion appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 19, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4130.3" n="B" level="2"> Aster Samius, <hi rend="ital">a kind of Samian earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose nature and healing power are described in</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 53, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astercum: <entryFree id="n4131" type="main" key="astercum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astercum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. astericum.</entryFree>
asteria: <entryFree id="n4132" type="main" key="aste^ri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)steria</foreign>, <sense id="n4132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">cat's-eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 47, § 131</bibl>.—Called in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 10, 3</bibl>. <orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕ-rītes</orth>; in <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, p. 19</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">astrītes</orth>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4133" type="main" key="Aste^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asteri/h</foreign>. <sense id="n4133.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Polus and Phœbe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of the fourth Hercules</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: Asterie, Hyg. Fab. prooem.— <cb n="ASTO" /> </sense><sense id="n4133.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of the Titan Cœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed by Jupiter into a quail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thrown into the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asterie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 53" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 53</bibl>. —In the place where she was cast down— the island of Delos—arose Ortygia (quail island); hence called, </sense><sense id="n4133.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astĕrĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4133.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient name of the island of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 132</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4133.4" n="V" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astĕriē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asteriace: <entryFree id="n4134" type="greek" key="aste^ri^a^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕrĭăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)steriakh/</foreign>, <sense id="n4134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a simple medicine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asterias: <entryFree id="n4135" type="greek" key="aste^ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕrĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)steri/as</foreign>, <sense id="n4135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of heron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardiolarum tria genera, leucon, asterias, pellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 79, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astericum: <entryFree id="n4136" type="greek" key="aste^ri^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)steriko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n4136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of plant</hi>, in pure Lat., urceolaris; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 43</bibl> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">astercum</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
asterion: <entryFree id="n4137" type="greek" key="aste^ri^o^n1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕrĭŏn</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ste/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n4137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4138" type="main" key="Aste^ri^o_n2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astĕrĭōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asteri/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n4138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Argolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:122" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 714</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asteriscus: <entryFree id="n4139" type="greek" key="aste^riscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)steri/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n4139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an asterisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a typographical mark placed before imperfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deficient passages of authors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">* asteriscus apponitur in his, quae omissa sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Rufin. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Hier. 10:2 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Hier. 10, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
asterites: <entryFree id="n4140" type="greek" key="aste^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĕrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)steri/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n4140.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of basilisk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4140.1" n="II" level="1"> = 1. asteria, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
asterno: <entryFree id="n4141" type="hapax" key="asterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-sterno</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adst-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strew upon;</hi> hence, mid., <hi rend="ital">to stretch one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie stretched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsternunturque sepulchro,</quote> <trans><tr>they prostrate themselves upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asthmaticus: <entryFree id="n4142" type="greek" key="asthma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asthmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sqmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with shortness of breath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coughing</hi> [<foreign lang="greek">a)=sqma</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">asthmatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asthmaticis in vino (radicem altheae) bibendam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 230</bibl></cit> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">spasticis</hi>); 26, 7, 19, § 34.</sense></entryFree>
asticus: <entryFree id="n4143" type="greek" key="asti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>games celebrated in the city in honor of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit> (al. <hi rend="ital">iselastici;</hi> v. iselasticus).</sense></entryFree>
astipulatio: <entryFree id="n4144" type="main" key="asti^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĭpŭlātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adst-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>astipulor</etym>; lit., <sense id="n4144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assent to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreement with;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n4144.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assenting to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirming the same facts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de re exstat etiam Annaei Senecae adstipulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4144.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A modulation of the voice according to the sentiment;</hi> Accedit enim vis et proprietas rebus tali adstipulatione, quae nisi adsit, aliud vox, aliud animus ostendat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:175" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astipulator: <entryFree id="n4145" type="main" key="asti^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĭpŭlātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adst-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n4145.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who joins another in a stipulation</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 110</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 117</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4145.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assistant in a trial</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">testes tot ... cum adstipulatore tuo comparabuntur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9</bibl>.—And trop., <hi rend="ital">one who assents to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agrees with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud falsum esse et Stoici dicunt et eorum adstipulator Antiochus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanae opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
astipulatus: <entryFree id="n4146" type="hapax" key="asti^pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astĭpŭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adst-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = astipulatio, <sense id="n4146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assenting to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis adstipulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 47, 48, § 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astipulor: <entryFree id="n4147" type="main" key="asti^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-stĭpŭlor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adst-</orth>, Weissenb., Jan), <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n4147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">adstĭpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer Gest. Alex. M 1:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer Gest. Alex. M 1, 18</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to join in a stipulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stipulate with</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 112</bibl>.— Trop, <hi rend="ital">to agree with one</hi>, = adsentiri: <cit><quote lang="la">adstipulari irato consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hellanico adstipulatur Damastes memorans, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astituo: <entryFree id="n4148" type="main" key="asti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-stĭtŭo</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">adst-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n4148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">somewhere</hi> (very rare, perh. only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">Juben an non jubes astitui aulas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit> Fleck.: reum ad lectum ejus (aegroti) astituemus, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 20</bibl> B. and K.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 130.</sense></entryFree>
asto: <entryFree id="n4149" type="main" key="asto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-sto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">asto</orth>, Fleck., Rib., B. and K.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">adsto</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Lachm.), stĭti, no <sense id="n4149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stand at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to stand by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi> (syn.: adsisto, adsum, faveo). </sense><sense id="n4149.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very freq. and class.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juxta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ante</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supra</hi>, etc.; with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, and <case>abl.</case>, and with <hi rend="ital">local adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">astitit illum locum, et illo, et illi, et circa illum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1181</bibl></cit> P.: marinas propter plagas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl> Müll. (Sat. v. 41 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si iste stabit, adstato simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3</bibl></cit>. 2, 75: cum omnis multitudo<cb n="ASTR" />  adstaret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 22, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos astare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstare ante Dominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra limen adstate illic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi confidenter contra adstitit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Postquam ille hinc abiit, tu adstas solus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:49 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 49 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsta atque audi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum patre astans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Alexander in Sigeo ad Achillis tumulum astitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eopse adstas lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astat in conspectu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis coram adstantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstat coram vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 702</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec opinanti Mors ad caput adstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:959" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 959</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstiterunt ad januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstiterunt juxta illos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui campis adstiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 36</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstabo tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 27, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem adstare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23, 2</bibl></cit>, where Keil reads <hi rend="ital">astaret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limine divae Adstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:607" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 607</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4149.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Certa quidem finis vitae mortalibus adstat,</quote> <trans><tr>awaits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1078" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1078</bibl></cit>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">to stand at</hi> one's side as counsel or aid, <hi rend="ital">to assist</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assisto, adsum, etc.): Amanti supparisator, hortor, adsto, admoneo, gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dum adsto advocatus cuidam cognato meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of an object <hi rend="ital">still existing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>: astante ope barbaricā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (for this Verg. has: Priami dum regna manebant, A. 2, 22).— </sense><sense id="n4149.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stand up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand upright</hi> (cf. ad, I. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">squamis astantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva, quae est in Parthenone adstans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">stans.</hi></sense></entryFree>
astomi: <entryFree id="n4150" type="main" key="Asto^mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astŏmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/astomoi</foreign> (without mouths), <sense id="n4150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Indian people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">said to have no mouths</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Astomorum gens sine ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astraba: <entryFree id="n4151" type="greek" key="Astra^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astrăba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stra/bh</foreign>, <sense id="n4151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden saddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sumpter-saddle; the title of a lost comedy attributed to Plautus;</hi> its authenticity was suspected even in ancient times; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 70</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. subscudes, p. 306 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
astraea: <entryFree id="n4152" type="main" key="Astraea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)astrai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of Justice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during the Golden Age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lived on the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but finally abandoned it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and returned to heaven</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oct. 424" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oct. 424</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jam redit et Virgo, i.e. Astraea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">As a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Libra;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">Virgo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 534</bibl>; cf. Arat. Phaen. 98.</sense></entryFree>
astraeus: <entryFree id="n4153" type="main" key="Astraeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astraeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)astrai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n4153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Titan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Aurora</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of the winds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which are hence called</hi> Astraei fratres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 545</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> German. Arat. 105</bibl>, Hes. Theog. 378 sq.</sense></entryFree>
astragalizontes: <entryFree id="n4154" type="greek" key="Astra^ga^li_zontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astrăgălīzontes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi( a)stragalizontes</foreign>, <sense id="n4154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dice-players</hi> (children), a celebrated group of statuary by Polycletus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astragalus: <entryFree id="n4155" type="greek" key="astra^ga^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrăgălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stra/galos</foreign> (the ankle-bone). <sense id="n4155.0" n="I" level="1"> In arch. </sense><sense id="n4155.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A little round moulding in the form of a ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which encircles the upper part of a column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an astragal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4155.2" n="B" level="2"> Lesbius, <hi rend="ital">a sort of moulding carved to represent a string of pearls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a festoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stem with seeds of grain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">olives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4155.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leguminous plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish tragacanth</hi>: Astragalus Baeticus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 29, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astralis: <entryFree id="n4156" type="hapax" key="astra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>astrum</etym>, <sense id="n4156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the stars</hi>: fata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">revealed by the stars</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
astrangulo: <entryFree id="n4157" type="hapax" key="astrangu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-strangŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strangle</hi>, Min. Felix, c. 30.</sense></entryFree>
astrape: <entryFree id="n4158" type="greek" key="Astra^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astrăpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)straph/</foreign>, <sense id="n4158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Flash of Lightning</hi> (personified), <hi rend="ital">a painting by Apelles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrapias: <entryFree id="n4159" type="greek" key="astra^pi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrăpĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)strapi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n4159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black in color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with gleams of light crossing the middle of it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrapoplectus: <entryFree id="n4160" type="greek" key="astra^po^ple_ctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrăpŏplēctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)strapoplhkto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">struck by lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astreans: <entryFree id="n4161" type="hapax" key="astre^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĕans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qs. <pos>P. a.</pos> from <pb n="184" /> <cb n="ASTR" /> astreo, āre; astrum</etym>, <sense id="n4161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gleaming like a star</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, p. 273</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
astrepo: <entryFree id="n4162" type="main" key="astre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-strĕpo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Halm), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n4162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4162.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make a noise at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> (only post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Tac.): totum mare immugit, omnes undique scopuli adstrepunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1027" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1027</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstrepebat volgus diversis incitamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volgus clamore et vocibus adstrepebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 90</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">verb act.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritis precibus surdas principis aures adstrepebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26, 2</bibl></cit> (Keil, <hi rend="ital">obstrepebant</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pauci incipiant, reliquos adstrepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4162.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi> adstrepere, like acclamo, <hi rend="ital">to shout applause to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to applaud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huzza</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstrepebat huic alacre vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec atque talia dicenti adstrepere volgus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astricte: <entryFree id="n4163" type="main" key="astricte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrictē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. astringo, <sense id="n4163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
astrictio: <entryFree id="n4164" type="main" key="astricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrictĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>astringo</etym>. <sense id="n4164.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A power of contracting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astringency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba gustūs amari cum adstrictione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 59, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4164.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The act of sharpening</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
astrictorius: <entryFree id="n4165" type="hapax" key="astricto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrictōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">binding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astringent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia (paliuri) adstrictoriam vim habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 71, § 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astrictus: <entryFree id="n4166" type="main" key="astrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrictus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>astringo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
astricus: <entryFree id="n4167" type="greek" key="astri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)striko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the stars</hi>: caeli choreae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 451, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrido: <entryFree id="n4168" type="hapax" key="astri_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-strīdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hiss at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe Ora reducentem premit adstridentibus hydris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:494" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 494</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astrifer: <entryFree id="n4169" type="main" key="astri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>astrum-fero</etym>. <sense id="n4169.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Starry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">axes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:752" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 752</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4169.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Placed among the stars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrifico: <entryFree id="n4170" type="hapax" key="astri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>astrum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n4170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make stars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archimedeā astrificante manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, p. 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astrificus: <entryFree id="n4171" type="main" key="astri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">star-producing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrificis caelum scandebat habenis nox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
astriger: <entryFree id="n4172" type="main" key="astri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>astrumgero</etym>, <sense id="n4172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">starry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">axes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:828" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 828</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astriloquus: <entryFree id="n4173" type="hapax" key="astri^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>astrum-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n4173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking of the stars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, p. 273</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astrilucus: <entryFree id="n4174" type="hapax" key="astri^lu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭlūcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>astrum-luceo</etym>, <sense id="n4174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gleaming like stars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
astringo: <entryFree id="n4175" type="main" key="astringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-stringo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl, Baiter, Halm, Jahn</itype>, Keil; <orth extent="full" lang="la">as-</orth>, Fleck., Merk., Kayser), <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tie together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi> (syn.: constringo, stringo, alligo, obligo, vincio). </sense><sense id="n4175.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hunc) adstringite ad columnam fortiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad statuam astrictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculorum, id est aptissimum ... quod ex se atque de iis, quae adstringit quam maxume, unum efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astringit vincula motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artius atque hederā procera adstringitur ilex,</quote> <trans><tr>is twined around with ivy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstringi funibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:27:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 27, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem adstringere loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 22, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum in jus Cervice adstrictā dominum trahat,</quote> <trans><tr>with a halter round his neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 88</bibl></cit> (Jahn, <hi rend="ital">obstrictā</hi>): aspice ... Quam non adstricto percurrat pulpita socco, <hi rend="ital">not drawn close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a negligent style of writing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ipse rotam adstringit multo sufflamine consul,</quote> <trans><tr>checks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balteus haud fluxos gemmis adstrinxit amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to contract</tr>, <tr>knit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:40" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra porriguntur et scinduntur et adstringuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondem ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut off</tr>, <tr>clip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:17 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 17 al.</bibl></cit>; so, alvum, <hi rend="ital">to make costive</hi> (opp. solvere, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 30</bibl>.—Of the contraction produced by cold: <cit><quote lang="la">nivibus quoque molle rotatis astringi corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 222</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis glacies astricta pependit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sic stat iners Scythicas adstringens Bosporus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis frigoris (corpora) ita adstringebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:6" default="NO">8, 4, 6</bibl>.—Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">to make colder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo (puteo) possis rursus adstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: corpus astringes brevi Salone, Mart. <cb n="ASTR" /> 1, 49, 11 (acc. to Varr. in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, adstrinxi for adstrictus sum, Varr. L. L. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 7</bibl>).—Of colors, <hi rend="ital">to deaden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita permixtis viribus alterum altero excitatur aut adstringitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl></cit> (diff. from alligare, which precedes; <cit><quote lang="la">v. alligo, I. B.).—Also of an astringent, harsh taste: radix gustu adstringit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 60, § 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4175.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw closer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumscribe; to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put under obligation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oblige</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi adfinitatem inter nos nostram adstrinxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: vellem, suscepisses juvenem regendum; <cit><quote lang="la">pater enim nimis indulgens, quicquid ego adstrinxi, relaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mores disciplinae severitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad adstringendam fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac lege tibi meam astringo fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (jure jurando) se cuncti astrinxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus tanti officii servitutem astringebam testimonio sempiterno,</quote> <trans><tr>to confirm</tr>, <tr>secure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Wund.: <cit><quote lang="la">religione devinctum astrictumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina astricta legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 10, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege et quaestione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis condicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor nullā ejus modi adstrictus necessitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem numeris astringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 173</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">adstringi sacris,</quote> <trans><tr>to be bound to maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inops regio, quae parsimoniā astringeret milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad temperantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad servitutem juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa servitus ad certa se verba adstringendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ad certam stipendiorum formulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me astringam verbis in sacra jura tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 320</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno scelere se astringeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 29, 82</bibl>; perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; instead of this <case>abl.</case> of class. Latin, we sometimes find in comedy apparently the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsum sese et illum furti adstringeret,</quote> <trans><tr>made guilty of</tr>, <tr>charged himself with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homo furti sese adstringet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Audin tu? hic furti se adligat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>; Draeger, Hist. Synt. I. § 209, regards this as a vulgar extension of the use of the <hi rend="ital">gen. with verbs of accusing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convicting</hi>, etc., but Klotz, s. v. astringo, regards it as really an old dative, furtoi furti; cf. quoi cui).—Of reasoning or discourse, <hi rend="ital">to compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring into short compass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici breviter adstringere solent argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 22</bibl>: Haec sic dicuntur a Stoicis, concludunturque contortius); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere tumentia, luxuriantia adstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit> Frotsch., Halm.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">astrictus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">drawn together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4175.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen astrictum,</quote> <trans><tr>shut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus fusior aut astrictior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus astrictum, i. e. alvus dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus morbi astrictum,</quote> <trans><tr>costiveness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustu adstricto,</quote> <trans><tr>of a harsh</tr>, <tr>astringent taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 96, § 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4175.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4175.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parsimonious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covetous</hi> (not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">astrictus pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstricti moris auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parsimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4175.6" n="2" level="3"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi> (opp. remissus): <cit><quote lang="la">dialectica quasi contracta et astricta eloquentia putanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:309" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum astricta comprehensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 95, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim finitimus oratori poëta, numeris astrictior paulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 60</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not used.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">astrictē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi> (only of discourse): <cit><quote lang="la">astricte numerosa oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 184</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrictius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille concludit adstrictius, hic latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 106</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not used.</sense></entryFree>
astrion: <entryFree id="n4176" type="greek" key="astri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)sth/r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n4176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crystalline precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found in India</hi>, considered by some <hi rend="ital">a kind of sapphire</hi>, by others as our <hi rend="ital">adularia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 48, § 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 13, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrisonus: <entryFree id="n4177" type="hapax" key="astri^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>astrumsono</etym>, <sense id="n4177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding with the stars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 308</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astrites: <entryFree id="n4178" type="main" key="astri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrītes</orth>, v. 1. asteria.</entryFree>
astroarche: <entryFree id="n4179" type="main" key="Astro^arche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Astrŏarchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)astroa/rxh</foreign>, <sense id="n4179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the star-queen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Phœnician goddess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, p. 273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrobolos: <entryFree id="n4180" type="greek" key="astro^bo^lo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏbŏlŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)sth/r-ba/llw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n4180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">a species of</hi> <cb n="ASTR" /> <hi rend="ital">onyx;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">chalcedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 50, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astroites: <entryFree id="n4181" type="greek" key="astro^i_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stroi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n4181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone of magical power</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 49, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astrologia: <entryFree id="n4182" type="greek" key="astro^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)strologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowledge of the stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astronomy</hi> (class. for the later astronomia, while astrologia was used to designate <hi rend="ital">astrology</hi> exclusively first in late Lat., <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Pelag. 1, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 9</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 87</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrologiam Atlas Libyae filius, ut alii Aegyptii, ut alii Assyrii invenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">a work upon astronomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasum matutinum vergiliarum Hesiodus, nam hujus quoque nomine exstat astrologia, tradidit fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 213</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
astrologus: <entryFree id="n4183" type="greek" key="astro^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)strolo/gos</foreign>. <sense id="n4183.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An astronomer</hi> (class. for the later astronomus; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:7" default="NO">2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 87</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a pun: (Verres) novus astrologus, qui non tam caeli rationem quam caelati argenti duceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4183.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A star-interpreter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astrologer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Astrologorum signa in caelo quaesit, observat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:Rel. p. 42" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 42</bibl></cit> Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:554" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astroonomia: <entryFree id="n4184" type="greek" key="astro^ono^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏonŏmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stronomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowledge of the stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astronomy</hi> (for the earlier astrologia, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 39.</sense></entryFree>
astronomicus: <entryFree id="n4185" type="greek" key="astro^no^mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏnŏmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)stronomiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">astronomical</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Astrŏnŏmĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the tille of an unfinished poem by Manilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of a treatise by Hyginus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
astronomus: <entryFree id="n4186" type="greek" key="astro^no^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrŏnŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)strono/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n4186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an astronomer</hi> (for the earlier astrologus, q. v.), Firm. Math. 5, 13.</sense></entryFree>
astrosus: <entryFree id="n4187" type="gloss" key="astro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> <etym>astrum</etym>, <sense id="n4187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born under an evil star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-starred</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astructio: <entryFree id="n4188" type="main" key="astructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astructĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>astruo</etym> (only in Capella). <sense id="n4188.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An accumulation of proof</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, p. 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4188.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 314</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
astructor: <entryFree id="n4189" type="hapax" key="astructor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astructor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who adduces proof</hi>, Venant. de Vita <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
astrum: <entryFree id="n4190" type="greek" key="astrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">astrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. <foreign lang="greek">a)/stron</foreign> borrowed; cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)sth/r</foreign>; Sanscr. staras (plur.); Engl. star; Germ. Stern; Goth. stairno; and stella; Kuhn compares: Sanscr. star, Lat. sterno, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">strw/nnumi</foreign>, Engl. strew, the stars being so called as strewn over the vault of heaven, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 10</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n4190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in more elevated prose). </sense><sense id="n4190.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 352</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 838</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 590</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:50" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16:15" default="NO">3, 16, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:21 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 21 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 12</bibl>.—In Vulg. only <number>plur.</number>: astra caeli, Deut. 4, 10; 10, 22; 28, 62: donec egrediantur astra, 2 Esdr. 4, 21: astra matutina, Job, 38, 7.—</sense><sense id="n4190.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4190.3" n="A" level="2"> For <hi rend="ital">height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris educta sub astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ter spumam elisam et rorantia vidimus astra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mons ibi verticibus petit arduus astra duobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super astra Dei exaltabo solium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 13 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4190.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the immortality of the glory connected with it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic itur ad astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inferre astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 846</bibl>: Daphnimque tuum tollemus ad astra; <cit><quote lang="la">Daphnim ad astra feremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">educere in astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentem rusticus urbem Tollit ad astra,</quote> <trans><tr>praises to the skies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 29 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortalus nostras laudes in astra sustulit,</quote> <trans><tr>extolled to the skies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. the opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">decidere ex astris, i. e. summam gloriam perdere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
astruo: <entryFree id="n4191" type="main" key="astru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-strŭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Merk., Halm, Dinter), <itype>struxi, structum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi> (mostly in prose and post-Aug.; never in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n4191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veteri adstruitur recens aedificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique (villae) quae desunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: sicut ante secunda fortuna tot victorias adstruxerat; <cit><quote lang="la">ita nunc adversa destruens quae cumulaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum adstruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 227" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4191.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4191.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstrue formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: victus ab <pb n="185" /> <cb n="ASTU" /> eo Pharnaces vix quicquam gloriae ejus adstruxit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid magnificentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 119</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:74:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 74, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nobilitatem ac decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulari ac triumphalibus ornamentis praedito quid aliud adstruere fortuna poterat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstruit auditis ... pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae Neroni falsus adstruit scriptor,</quote> <trans><tr>ascribes</tr>, <tr>imputes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Livium quoque priorum aetati adstruas, i.e. annumeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4191.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with something</hi> (syn. instruo): <cit><quote lang="la">contignationem laterculo adstruxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>covered</tr>, <tr>fastened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem falsis criminibus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.!*? The signif. <hi rend="ital">affirmare</hi>, which Agroet. p. 2268 P., and Beda, p. 2334 P. give, is found in no Lat. author; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 83</bibl>, instead of <hi rend="ital">adstruxerunt</hi>, it is better to read <hi rend="ital">adseverant;</hi> v. Sillig ad h. l.; so also Jan.</sense></entryFree>
