At etiam cesso foribus facere hisce assulas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: Quid tum esse existimas judicatum? Certe gratīs judicāsse. At condemnārat; at causam totam non audierat; <cit><quote lang="la">at in contionibus etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sit flagitiorum omnium princeps: at est bonus imperator, at felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:B. 16:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. B. 16, 5</bibl> B. and K.: Nefarius Hippias Pisistrati filius arma contra patriam ferens; <cit><quote lang="la">at Sulla, at Marius, at Cinna recte, imo jure fortasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: At non formosa est, at non bene culta puella; <cit><quote lang="la">At, puto, non votis saepe petita meis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 1 sq.</bibl></cit> Merk.: <cit><quote lang="la">At quam sunt similes, at quam formosus uterque!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:395" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 395</bibl></cit>: rideri possit eo quod Rusticius tonso toga defluit: at est bonus ut melior vir Non alius quisquam; at tibi amicus; <cit><quote lang="la">at ingenium ingens Inculto latet hoc sub corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit> sqq. (cf. sed— <cit><quote lang="la">sed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:149" default="NO">8, 149</bibl>; and a similar use of <foreign lang="greek">a)lla/</foreign> in Hellenistic Greek, as <foreign lang="greek">a)lla/</foreign>—<foreign lang="greek">a)lla/</foreign>, 2 Cor. 2, 17: <foreign lang="greek">a)lla/</foreign>—<foreign lang="greek">a)lla/</foreign> —<foreign lang="greek">a)lla/</foreign>, 1 Cor. 6, 11).—</sense><sense id="n4220.36" n="B" level="2"> Though regularly occupying the first place in its clause or sentence, it sometimes stands second (cf. atque <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Saepius at si me, Lycida formose, revisas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tutior at quanto merx est in classe secundā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mentior at si quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gramineis ast inde toris discumbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:255" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Major at inde etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:116" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 116</bibl></cit>.—See more upon this word in Hand, Turs. I. pp. 417-451; Wagner, Quaest. XXXVII. ad Verg. IV. pp. 581- 585.</sense></entryFree>
atabulus: <entryFree id="n4221" type="main" key="A^ta_bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătābŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning wind blowing in Apulia</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">sirocco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 232</bibl>; also mentioned by Horace, S. 1, 5, 78; <cit><quote lang="la">and hence, Atabulus Horatianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
atacinus: <entryFree id="n4222" type="main" key="A^ta^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătăcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the river Atax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">Atacian</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătăcīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>: P. Terentius Varro Atacinus, <hi rend="ital">a poet from that region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourishing in the time of Cœsar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single fragments of whose writings are yet extant; the author of an</hi> Argonautica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 46</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:85" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 87</bibl>; Bähr, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 128, and Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 208, 1. (Upon his measure and style, cf. Spald. and Frotsch. ad Quint. l. l.)</sense></entryFree>
atalanta: <entryFree id="n4223" type="main" key="A^ta^lanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătălanta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 775</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)atala/nth</foreign>. <sense id="n4223.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of King Schœneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for her swiftness in running</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquered by Hippomenes</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">by Milanion</hi>) <hi rend="ital">by stratagem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and married by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 565</bibl> sqq.; 10, 598 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 185" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4223.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Iasius of Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a participant in the Calydonian boar-hunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and passionately<cb n="ATER" />  loved by Meleager</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 99</bibl> (called, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 380</bibl>, Tegeaea; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:426" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 426</bibl>, Nonacria, v. h. v.).—</sense><sense id="n4223.2" n="III" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4223.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătălantaeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Atalanta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:309" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Schoenos,</quote> <trans><tr>a town in Arcadia</tr>, <tr>in the vicinity of which Atalanta established foot-races</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:267" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 267</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4223.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătălantĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Atalanta and Meleager</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Parthenopœus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:789" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 789</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atanuvium: <entryFree id="n4224" type="gloss" key="atanuvi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">atanuvĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">athanuvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of earthen bowl used by the Roman priests in offering sacrifices</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 18</bibl> Müll.; v. Müll. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
atargatis: <entryFree id="n4225" type="main" key="A^targa^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătargătis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ata/rgatis</foreign>, <sense id="n4225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Syrian deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Derceto (<foreign lang="greek">*derketw/</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> p. 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atarnea: <entryFree id="n4226" type="main" key="Atarne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Atarnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ata/rna</foreign>, Steph. Byz.; more com. <foreign lang="greek">*)atarneu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Mysia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Atarnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Atarnea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl>; cf. Mann. Asia Min. III. pp. 398 and 415.</sense></entryFree>
atat: <entryFree id="n4227" type="greek" key="a^ta^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătăt</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">attat</orth>, <itype>also several times repeated, atatatae, attatatatae, or atatte, atattate</itype>, etc., <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ttatai/, a)ttatatai/</foreign>, etc.; an exclamation of joy, pain, wonder, fright, warning, etc., <sense id="n4227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oh! ah! alas! lo! strange!</hi> etc.: Quid salve, atattatattatae, rivalis, salve; quid istuc attatae advertisti tam cito? Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">attatatae, cave cadas, amabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 213 P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Attat, perii hercle ego miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atat eccam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atat hoc illud est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 1 al.</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. pp. 451 and 452; Bentl. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atavia: <entryFree id="n4228" type="main" key="a^ta^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătăvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>atavus</etym>, <sense id="n4228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of a great-great-grandfather</hi> (abavus) or <hi rend="ital">greatgreat-grandmother</hi> (abavia), <hi rend="ital">a fourth grandmother</hi>, opp. to adneptis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO">38, 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atavus: <entryFree id="n4229" type="main" key="a^ta^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătăvus</orth> (archaic, <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>at avus</etym>, <sense id="n4229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of a great-great-grandfather</hi> (abavus) or <hi rend="ital">great-great-grandmother</hi>, opp. to adnepos. </sense><sense id="n4229.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, 38, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 5, 9</bibl> and 10; 9, 6, 23 and 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4229.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., sometimes, like avus, abavus, etc., for <hi rend="ital">ancestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forefather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus avis atavisque potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Evocat antiquis proavos atavosque sepulchris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas, atavis edite regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
atax: <entryFree id="n4230" type="main" key="A^tax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/atac</foreign>, <sense id="n4230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Aude</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 403</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 15</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. p. 63.</sense></entryFree>
atella: <entryFree id="n4231" type="main" key="A_tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ate/lla</foreign>. <sense id="n4231.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient town of the Osci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Clanius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the present Aversa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 14</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 779.—</sense><sense id="n4231.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātellānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Atella</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atellan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātel-lāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Atella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>.—But esp. freq. Atellana fabula, fabella, or simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātellāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a comic but not wanton kind of popular farce that originated in Atella</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the comedy borrowed from Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was highly relished at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially by the youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and continued to be represented even to the time of the emperors;</hi> the class. passage for it is <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:8" default="NO">17, 2, 8</bibl>; Fest. s. v. personata, p. 217 Müll.; Diom. pp. 487 and 488 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7</bibl>, §§ 29, 84; 95 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7 al.</bibl>; cf. Munk de Fabulis Atellanis, Lips. 1840, and Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> §§ 6, 4 and 9 sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4231.2" n="III" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4231.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātellā-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an actor in an Atellan farce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 47</bibl>; also as <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesticulator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4231.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātellā-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Atellan farce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4231.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātellānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">exodium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4231.6" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātellānĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <hi rend="ital">a small Atellan piece</hi>, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ater: <entryFree id="n4232" type="main" key="a_ter1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ai)/qw</foreign>, to burn; Sanscr. idh; <foreign lang="greek">ai)/qwn ai)qh/r, *ai)/tnh</foreign>, <pb n="188" /> <cb n="ATHA" /> Aetna, aether, aestus, aestas</etym> (pr. burnt black, black as a coal; cf.: <sense id="n4232.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Tam excoctam reddam atque atram quam carbost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: hence), <hi rend="ital">black;</hi> and specif., <hi rend="ital">coalblack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lustreless-black</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi> (opp. albus, lustreless-white, and diff. from niger, glossy black, v. albus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; class. and freq., but never in Vulg., which uses niger). </sense><sense id="n4232.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">album an atrum vinum potas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrior multo Quam Aegyptii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba et atra discernere non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>: nigra scuta, tincta corpora; <cit><quote lang="la">atras ad proelia noctes legunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mos erat antiquus niveis atrisque capillis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 44</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">albus: fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen, with smoke,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen, with dust,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 450</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">axis, with blood,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:186" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eridanus ater stragibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">melagxoli/a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:258 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 258 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 693</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus atro gutture,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:108:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 108, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 966</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Cocytus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>dark</tr>, <tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: mons, v. 2. ater.— The proverb albus an ater, v. albus.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, = atratus, <hi rend="ital">clothed in black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. albus, I. B. 2.—</sense><sense id="n4232.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4232.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">black</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> [173], and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 254</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 429</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila trium sororum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Esquiliae (as a burying-place),</quote> <trans><tr>dismal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu mors atris circumvolat alis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:63 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 63 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genius .. vultu mutabilis, albus et ater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 189</bibl></cit>.—In Roman civil life, dies atri are the days on which the state experienced some calamity, <hi rend="ital">unlucky days.</hi> (This designation is said to have arisen from the Roman custom of marking every unfortunate day in the calendar with coal); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 17</bibl>; Fest. s. v. nonarum, p. 179 Müll.; id. s. v. religiosus, p. 278 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 418</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> and 16; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 73, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si atro die faxit insciens, probe factum esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4232.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4232.5" n="1" level="3"> Rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of mind or feeling, <hi rend="ital">malevolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virulent</hi> (cf. niger, II. D., and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/las</foreign>, II. 4 Lidd. and Scott): <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis atro dente me petiverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4232.6" n="2" level="3"> Also <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of something difficult to be understood, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (so <foreign lang="greek">me/las</foreign>, Anth. Pal. 11, 347): <cit><quote lang="la">latebrae Lycophronis atri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> p. 5, 3, 157</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not used.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4233" type="main" key="A_ter2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āter</orth> <itype>mons</itype>, <sense id="n4233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in the interior of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of Phazania</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Fezzan</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 35</bibl>.<</sense></entryFree>
aternius: <entryFree id="n4234" type="main" key="A_terni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āternĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman family name</hi>: Aternius Fontinalis, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> A. U. C. 300, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:35:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 35, 60</bibl> Mai; from him proceeded the Lex Aternia (or Tarpeia; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. s. v. peculatus, p. 237 Müll.): de multā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aternus: <entryFree id="n4235" type="main" key="A_ternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āternus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aternos</foreign>, <sense id="n4235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Samnium emptying into the Adriatic Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pescara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.—At its mouth was the town <orth extent="full" lang="la">Āter-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aternon</foreign>, named after it, now also called <hi rend="ital">Pescara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Mann. Ital. I. p. 468.—Hence, Aternensis ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. p. 120" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. p. 120</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
ateste: <entryFree id="n4236" type="main" key="A^teste"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăteste</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ateste/</foreign> (Ptol.), <sense id="n4236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the country of the Venetians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:122" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 17, 26, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 6</bibl>; later called Ad Este and Ab Este, whence arose the present name, <hi rend="ital">Este;</hi> cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 97.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Ateste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:93" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 93</bibl>: <itype>ATESTINI, ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ateste</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
athacus: <entryFree id="n4237" type="main" key="A^tha^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aqakos</foreign>, <sense id="n4237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
athamania: <entryFree id="n4238" type="main" key="A^tha^ma_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqamani/a</foreign>. <sense id="n4238.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on or near Mount Pindus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4238.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4238.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămānes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqama=nes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Athamania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40</bibl>; <cb n="ATHE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4238.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthă-mānis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Athamanian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 311</bibl> Jahn.—</sense><sense id="n4238.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Athamania</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
athamas: <entryFree id="n4239" type="main" key="A^tha^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqa/mas</foreign>. <sense id="n4239.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Æolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandson of Hellen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king in Thessaly</hi> (<hi rend="ital">first in Bœotia in</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*)aqama/ntion pedi/on</foreign>, among the Orchomeni, O. Müll. Orchom. I. p. 161), <hi rend="ital">the father of Helle and Phrixus by Nephele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of Melicerta and Learchus by Ino;</hi> in a fit of madness he pursued Ino, who, with Melicerta, threw herself into the sea, and both were changed to sea-deities, Ino to Leucothea (Matuta), and Melicerta to Palaemon (Portunus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 564</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 420</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:903" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 903</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 489</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 241</bibl>; cf. Apollod. 3, p. 171; Paus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> p. 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athamante dementior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4239.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4239.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqamantei=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Athamas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Athamantic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:143" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the golden fleece of Phrixus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4239.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămantĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqamantia/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">son of Athamas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Palœmon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 919</bibl> (this word also stands by conj. of Hertzberg in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:6:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 6, 22</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n4239.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthămantis</orth> <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqamanti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Athamas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Helle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:903" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 903</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4239.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthă-mantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqamantiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Athamantic</hi>: meum, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear's-wort</hi>: Athamanta meum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 94, § 253</bibl> (by many of the ancients referred to Athamas, I., as named by him, v. Plin. l. l.).</sense></entryFree>
athanagia: <entryFree id="n4240" type="main" key="A^tha^na_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthănāgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now acc. to Ukert, <hi rend="ital">Agramant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61</bibl>; cf. Mann. Hispan. p. 401.</sense></entryFree>
athanasius: <entryFree id="n4241" type="main" key="A^tha^na_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthănāsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqana/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n4241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated archbishop of Alexandria in the time of the emperor Constantine;</hi> a zealous persecutor of the Arians, and by them much persecuted in return; he died A. D. 377.</sense></entryFree>
athanatus: <entryFree id="n4242" type="main" key="A^tha^na^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthănătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)qa/natos</foreign>, immortal</etym>, <sense id="n4242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man of gigantic stature and superhuman strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Pliny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>.<</sense></entryFree>
athenae: <entryFree id="n4243" type="main" key="A^the_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqh=nai</foreign>. <sense id="n4243.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Thess. 3, 1</bibl> al.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Mann. Gr. p. 308 sq.,</quote> <trans><tr>the Grecian city of the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence sometimes meton. for <hi rend="ital">intelligence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 110</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Athenae Novae, as an appel. of honor for Mediolanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4243.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of other cities in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Acarnania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arabia</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 35</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
athenaeopolitae: <entryFree id="n4244" type="gloss" key="A^the_naeo^po^li_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnaeŏpŏlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Athenœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an otherwise unknown town</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 35</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
athenaeum: <entryFree id="n4245" type="main" key="A^the_naeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqh/naion</foreign>, <sense id="n4245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Athamania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
athenaeus: <entryFree id="n4246" type="main" key="A^the_naeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqhnai=os</foreign>. <sense id="n4246.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the city of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Athens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenaeis in moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 749</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl> in indic. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 8, 11</bibl>, and 12 al.—</sense><sense id="n4246.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Athene</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>): <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqh/naion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a temple of Minerva at Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which scholars and poets were accustomed to read their works</hi> (as the Rom. poets in the temple of Apollo at Rome; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aedes, I.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 35</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a similar building for the same object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by the emperor Adrian at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4247" type="main" key="A^the_naeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aqhnai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n4247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek grammarian of Naucratis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of the emperor M. Aurelius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the compilation entitled</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*deipnosofistai/</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
atheniensis: <entryFree id="n4248" type="main" key="A^the_ni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthēnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Athenae</etym>, <sense id="n4248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistocles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthē-nĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Athenians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:75 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 75 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 44, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 17, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 22</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
athenio: <entryFree id="n4249" type="main" key="Athe_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Athēnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader in a slave - insurrection in Sicily</hi>, A. U. C. 652, <cb n="ATIN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26</bibl>, and 2, 3, 54.—Applied contemptuously to Sex. Clodius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3</bibl>. 12, 2.</sense></entryFree>
atheos: <entryFree id="n4250" type="greek" key="a^the^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăthĕŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/qeos</foreign>, <sense id="n4250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that does not believe in God</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an atheist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diagoras, atheos qui dictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl></cit> B. and K. (Orelli writes it as Greek); so <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 178.</sense></entryFree>
athera: <entryFree id="n4251" type="greek" key="a^the_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăthēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)qh/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n4251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine prepared from</hi> arinca: <cit><quote lang="la">Olyram arincam diximus vocari. Hac decoctā fit medicamentum, quod Aegyptii atheram vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 57, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
atherianus: <entryFree id="n4252" type="main" key="A^theri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătherĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a jurist Atherius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atherian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 3</bibl></cit> (Aterianus, Atterianus, Orell., B. and K.; al. Haterianus).</sense></entryFree>
atheroma: <entryFree id="n4253" type="greek" key="athe_^ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">athē^rōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)qe/rwma</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">a)qh/rwma</foreign>), <sense id="n4253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling upon the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tumor filled with matter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
athesis: <entryFree id="n4254" type="main" key="A^the^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthĕsis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Athesim; <case>abl.</case> Athesi; v. Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 210, 228), = <foreign lang="greek">*)/atagis</foreign>, Strabo, <sense id="n4254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Upper Italy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Adige</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atesis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 121</bibl></cit> Jan: <cit><quote lang="la">Athesim propter amoenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 680</bibl></cit> Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:595" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 595</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 196</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 143.</sense></entryFree>
athis: <entryFree id="n4255" type="main" key="Athis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Athis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Athin), <sense id="n4255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Limnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 72</bibl> Merk. (al. <hi rend="ital">Athys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Attis</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
athla: <entryFree id="n4256" type="main" key="athla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">athla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. athlon.</entryFree>
athleta: <entryFree id="n4257" type="greek" key="a_thle_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āthlēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> athletes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:53:222" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 53, 222</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> athletam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 32, 593), = <foreign lang="greek">a)qlhth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prize-fighter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">athlete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 22 al.</bibl>— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by exertion and practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">has acquired much skill in a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a champion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi> (only ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecuarii athletae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athletae comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
athletice: <entryFree id="n4258" type="main" key="a_thle_ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āthlētĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. athleticus <sense id="n4258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
athleticus: <entryFree id="n4259" type="greek" key="a_thle_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āthlētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)qlhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the athlete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">athletic</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; also without ars: <orth extent="full" lang="la">āthlētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the athletic art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">athletics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 205</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">āthlētĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">athletically</hi>, only in Plaut.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pancratice atque athletice (valuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valet pugilice atque athletice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
athlon: <entryFree id="n4260" type="greek" key="a_thlon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āthlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">āthla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, like schema, diadema, dogma; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. p. 274</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">a)=qlon</foreign>, <sense id="n4260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pains</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 193 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
athos: <entryFree id="n4261" type="main" key="A^tho_^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăthō^s</orth> (upon the length of the <sense id="n4261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">o</hi> in Athos, cf. Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 332</bibl>; <case>nom.</case> also Atho, Athon; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> not found, yet it may be assumed as Ăthōnis; <case>dat.</case> Atho; <case>acc.</case> Atho, Athŏn, Athonem, and, acc. to Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 701</bibl>, also Athona; <case>abl.</case> Athone; cf. Seyfert, Gr. §§ 1498-1500; Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 638, 344, 132), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aqws</foreign>, later <foreign lang="greek">*)/aqwn, wnos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Athos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a high mountain on the Strymonian Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Lemnos</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Agion Oros</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Monte Santo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl> and 10; 2, 7, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 23, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 332</bibl> (as an imitation of Theocr. 7, 77); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 701</bibl>; Ov M. 2, 217; 11, 554; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:664" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 664</bibl>; Juv 10, 174; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 145" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 336</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV Cons. Hon. 475</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutr 2, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gigant. 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 127</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> Athōnes, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
atilianus: <entryFree id="n4262" type="main" key="A^ti_li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Atilius.</entryFree>
atilius: <entryFree id="n4263" type="main" key="A^ti_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n4263.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman gentile name</hi>, e. g. M. Atilius Regulus, Atilius Rufus, Atilius Verus, etc.—</sense><sense id="n4263.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4263.2" n="A" level="2"> Atilia lex de dediticiis, <hi rend="ital">introduced by the tribune of the people L. Atilius</hi>, A. U. C. 544, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33</bibl> and 34.—</sense><sense id="n4263.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Atilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <trans><tr>that of Atilius Regulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>, ext. 6.</sense></entryFree>
atina: <entryFree id="n4264" type="main" key="A_ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātīna</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/atina</foreign>. <sense id="n4264.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Latium</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Atina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 630</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 675.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4264.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Atina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atinatic</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Atinatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Atinati,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Atinatic territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Atina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4264.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <pb n="189" /> <cb n="ATLA" /> <hi rend="ital">town of the Venetians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. p. 95.—</sense><sense id="n4264.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Lucania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Atena;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ātīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Atinatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Atinate campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
atinia: <entryFree id="n4265" type="main" key="A^ti_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătīnia</orth> <itype>ulmus</itype>, v. Atinius, II. B.</entryFree>
atinius: <entryFree id="n4266" type="main" key="A^ti_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n4266.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g. C. Atinius Labeo, etc.— </sense><sense id="n4266.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4266.2" n="A" level="2"> Atinia lex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 4</bibl>; cf. Hugo, Rechtsgesch. p. 381.—</sense><sense id="n4266.3" n="B" level="2"> Atinia ulmus, <hi rend="ital">a kind of elm-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the loose-flowering elm</hi>: Ulmus effusa, Willd.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 17, 29, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atintania: <entryFree id="n4267" type="main" key="A^tinta_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătintānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)atintani/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atius: <entryFree id="n4268" type="main" key="A^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens., e. g. M. Atius Balbus, etc., and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Atius Balbus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl> and 94; cf. Atys.</sense></entryFree>
atizoe: <entryFree id="n4269" type="greek" key="a^ti^zo_e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătĭzōē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)tizw/h</foreign>, <sense id="n4269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a silver lustre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atlantigena: <entryFree id="n4270" type="main" key="A_^tlanti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Atlas-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n4270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">begotten of Atlas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Atlas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Maia;</hi> old poet in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> Burm. 2, p. 364</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atlantion: <entryFree id="n4271" type="greek" key="a_^tlanti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā^tlantĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Atlas</etym>, <sense id="n4271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lowest vertebra of the neck</hi> (so called because on it rests the whole burden of the head and the remaining vertebrae of the neck): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc spinae articulum sive nodum Atlantion vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
atlas: <entryFree id="n4272" type="main" key="A_^tla_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/atlas</foreign>. <sense id="n4272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Atlas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a high mountain in Mauretania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the northwest part of Libya</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which</hi>, acc. to the fable, <hi rend="ital">heaven rested</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 11</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 296</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 247</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 796</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 150" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 150</bibl> (cf. Hom. Od. 1, 52; 4, 385; Hdt. 3, 2; 4, 148; Apollod. 2, 5, 11; Diod. Sic. 3, 5).—</sense><sense id="n4272.1" n="II" level="1"> In mythology, <hi rend="ital">a king of Mauretania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Iapetus and Clymene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lover of astronomy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:628 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 628 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">changed by Perseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the aid of Medusa's head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into Mount Atlas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because he refused him a hospitable reception as guest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:657 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 657 sq.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">He was the father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by Pleione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the seven Pleiades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by Æthra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the seven</hi> (acc. to Hyg. five) <hi rend="ital">Hyades.</hi>—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a man of colossal height</hi>, and iron. for <hi rend="ital">a dwarf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.2" n="III" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4272.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Mount Atlas</hi>, as a designation for <hi rend="ital">westAfrican</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the Atlantic Ocean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accola,</quote> <trans><tr>dwelling on Atlas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:185" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>citrus-wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:89" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. Atlantis, 1.—</sense><sense id="n4272.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:200" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the heaven borne by Atlas</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Atlas</hi>, and, </sense><sense id="n4272.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Of Mount Atlas</hi>, as a designation for <hi rend="ital">west-African</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 11</bibl></cit>: Oceanus, <hi rend="ital">the Atlantic Ocean</hi>, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 280; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">id. Prob. et Olyb. Cons. 35: gurges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to King Atlas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pleiades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.8" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^t-lantĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of King Atlas.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4272.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the grandson of Atlas by Maia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 704</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 834</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 627</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nepos Atlantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:663" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 1</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n4272.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Hermaphroditus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatgrandson of Atlas and son of Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 368</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.11" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Atlas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pleiades</tr>, <tr>daughters of Atlas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:136" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calypso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 69</bibl></cit> (cf. Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 685</bibl> P.: apud nympham Atlantis filiam Calypsonem).—</sense><sense id="n4272.12" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n4272.13" n="1" level="3"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Mount Atlas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <trans><tr>a citrus forest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. Atlanticus.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of several islands in the Atlantic Ocean</hi>, of which the largest, acc. to Plato, was said to have sunk (some consider this as America), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 90, 92, § 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 31, 36, § 190</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.14" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to King Atlas;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his female posterity;</hi> thus the Pleiades and Hyades, connected as constellations in the heavens, are called <hi rend="ital">Atlantides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 192" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 21</bibl>: Eoae Atlantides, <hi rend="ital">the Pleiades</hi>, called Vergiliae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 221</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:54" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 54</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Electra</hi>, one of the Pleiades, Ov F. 4, 31; and <hi rend="ital">of Calypso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl>. <cb n="ATQU" /> —</sense><sense id="n4272.15" n="G" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Atlas; Hermaphroditus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his great-grandson by Mercury</hi> (cf. Atlantiades), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 271" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 271</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.16" n="IV" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^tlantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Libyan people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8:5" default="NO">1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:44 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 44 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4272.17" n="V" level="1"> Atlantes = Gigantes, Naev. Bell. Punic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
atocium: <entryFree id="n4273" type="greek" key="a^to^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătŏcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)to/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n4273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine that prevents conception</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
atomus: <entryFree id="n4274" type="greek" key="a^to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/tomos</foreign>. <sense id="n4274.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uncut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci (tus) stagonian et atomum tali modo appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 62</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n4274.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ătŏmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h( a)/tomos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an indivisible element.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4274.2" n="A" level="2"> Of matter, <hi rend="ital">an atom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which particles</hi>, acc. to the doctrine of Democritus, <hi rend="ital">all things are composed</hi> (the distinction between an atom, an ultimate particle of matter, and a molecule, the ultimate combination of matter, was of course unknown to the ancients; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: corpora, corpora parva, corpora minuta, corpuscula, Lucr., Cic.): atomi, id est corpora individua propter soliditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 2</bibl>; Lact. de Ira Dei, 10 (where, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 2</bibl>, acc. to several editt., it stands as <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 2, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n4274.3" n="B" level="2"> Of time: in atomo, after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)n a)to/mw|</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">in a moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the twinkling of an eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 42</bibl> and 51; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 24</bibl>; so in the Gr.
